Each room had a flat screen TV, there was one walk in closet, a fridge and a coffee maker. The beds were great. The pillows varied and I slept fine until the protest at 7am on Sunday morning. There were protesters at the Frank Hotel that woke the entire block up with sirens and mega phone chanting and I resent that because we had been up early every day for the conference and Sunday was our only day to sleep. The noise wasn't too bad for being above the street and I slept fine until the protesters woke me. I don't sympathize with the protesters because of their wake up service. The window with the best view had a broken blind and it was some work to tie it up to really get that uninterrupted view while having company later on the night of our stay. I would choose the family suite again but not the regular rooms. The service was the best of any hotel and they worked with me every step of the way. Some rooms are VERY SMALL. Make Sure you know your limits. If you need air and a street view, ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: christi_10
Reviews.Content: awesome location very close to powell street bart station so our commute from the airport was easy. other public transportation (cable and street cars) were easily accessible as well. the hotel was close to starbucks and walgreens as well as lots of shopping and restaurants. was pleasantly surprised to find mouthwash and q-tips in our bathroom. nice touch! enjoyed the balcony and the large premier king room very much. yes, there were protesters at the hotel across the street. san franciscans will protest ANYTHING. we couldn't hear them once inside. the only noise we heard was the guys next door coming in on saturday night at 2 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price but hotel a little tired”
Reviews.Author: kiwigonzo
Reviews.Content: The Handlery Union Square Hotel is ideally located for visitors looking to see the sights as well as conference attendees at the nearby Moscone West Conference Center. The staff are pleasant and obliging. The rooms (in the older section) are adequate, but the decor is tired and they could do with double glazing. Yes, that noisy picket line at a neighbouring hotel was a regular, but unnecessary alarm clock. The price was very good with a net rate of 149 per night. Very competitive for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: igirisunjin
Reviews.Content: I stayed again at the hotel for the second time in two months on business. This time I stayed in the older and more historic part of the hotel. The newer section has the premium rooms which are larger, you get free wifi and cost about $30 more. I actually preferred staying in the older part of the hotel. The hotel is right next to Union Square. It is also next to the Tenderloin. So there are a lot of homeless people around the area begging for money.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: Mommystyle
Reviews.Content: I always tell people that I love this hotel. We stayed last month and we had our best ever stay. The reasons are to follow: **Everyone on the staff is very nice. They understand that guests are on vacation, and they give their best consistently. The concierge staff went above and beyond for us when we had a box that we sent via Fedex returned (after our departure). The bell staff, Front Desk, everyone was so nice and helpful.....every time you come in contact with them! **Daily Grill is a great restaurant with a great bar. Ken (our favorite bartender there) remembered what my husband likes to drink even though it has been 3 year since our last visit! He is a class-act who gave us great tips on places to visit in Sausalito. Food is really good (try the spinach mashed potatoes). **Rooms are nice, great beds, bedding, pillows. We had a room with a balcony that overlooked Geary Street. Wi-fi is free. **Location is great. It's near so many restaurants, bars, stores. Transportation is easy from there because it's in Union Square. We will definitely be back! Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: yami810
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Handlery Union Square was very pleasant. We stayed in the historic side of the hotel, which had lots of character. The rooms were a good size taking into account that it's in Union Square. I am very picky with cleanliness and our room exceeded expectations in this regard. The price we paid through the hotel website was better than any offered through other travel sites. THe best thing about staying at the Handlery was its location. Steps from the corner of Geary and Powell, there were many places to shop, eat and people-watch right outside the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good. Still room for Improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Mikeman222
Reviews.Content: The Handerley is a very good hotel.... but there is always room for Improvement. Location was Perfect.... love the Fact that there is Macys Men and Macy's Women close by. we at the cheesecake factory one night ( which is located at the very top floor of Macy's Women ). Did some shopping in the Giants Dugout. We also got lots of Christmas Shopping done as well... ( Mostly done at Macy's by the way ). The one thing i would Question tho... is the Size of the Bathtub in the room.All of us had trouble fittting in it to have a bath. Thats the one Part that Improvemt Can be made.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: narelle524
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the middle of the city and on cable car line. Close to restaurants and shopping. Very clean and tidy and comfortable beds and pillows. Stay is back rooms if you are a light sleeper. Did not hear a sound.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarlowIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the start of November,,,What a great location... They gave us vouchers for breakfast in the Daily Grill, it was great.. We had our own kettle which broke in transit and they even provided another one for our stay, there was a coffee maker in the room but my friends sre tea drinkers.. We were in the old building but the rooms were nicely furnished and beds very comfortable. Couldnt believe we were so central to everything.... Very pleasant staff,and good house-keeping.... What more can i say, we had dinner one night in the Daily Grill, excellent, service, price and very friendly waiting staff. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel, We have travelled all over the world and have often paid a lot more for a much inferior hotel... Hope to be back some day.. Marion Lowry....Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sooze_68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally 50 metres from Union Square and access to the cable cars. We had a newer room around the pool at the rear of the property. It was very quiet. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed. Free wi fi in room was great. I would recommend this hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem, absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Vicki P
Reviews.Content: I really cannot speak highly enough of this hotel; we stayed here for 3 nights in September on the 3rd leg of our honeymoon. Upon check in we were given a complimentary upgrade to the new part of the hotel overlooking the pool area with a nice balcony and there was a bottle of champagne waiting for us when we entered the room, it was such a lovely touch seeing as nowhere else on our trip had acknowledged that it was our honeymoon. The little added extras you get with this hotel are just fantastic, they absolutely go above and beyond the call of duty, from little toothbrushes, toothpaste and bottles of mouthwash to â€œsnack packsâ€� filled with bottled water, crisps, fruit and oat bars. They put a daily paper under your door during the night so itâ€™s waiting for you as soon as you wake up. You are given free breakfast vouchers every day where you can choose from a selection of 3, and the breakfasts are really good (tip: get down early as it gets very very busy and you may end up having a long wait). The rooms are really lovely, very spacious and clean, with all the mod cons you could need; fridge, large flat screen TV, huge comfy beds, lounge area, coffee & tea making facilities, iron, separate vanity area with mirrors galore, fluffy gowns and slippers. The staff is so friendly and went out of their way to help us â€“ the street outside the hotel was closed off due to a potential gas leak just as we were waiting for our transfer to the airport to arrive but they couldnâ€™t get to us. The manager of the hotel arranged for us to be taken through the main hotel and out through the back so that we could access another street, they then organised a taxi for us so that we could make our flight. They were just great. There is just one small negative that I can mention and that is that you have to carry your suitcases up a flight of stairs to get to the new part of the building, this was a bit of a pain as we had a lot of luggage, but in the grand scheme of things not a problem. The location is good, just off union square. Thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Historic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Klaus37
Reviews.Content: Union SquareÂ´s and Market StreetÂ´s shoppes around the corner? A pleasant stroll to China TownsÂ´s gate or the Asian Art Museum? The Handlery is the place. Especially if you get a quiet charming and fully renovated historic room as we have got.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: martinaHly
Reviews.Content: stayed here with a group of friends, thought it was a fantastic hotel, really clean, reasonable and you could not get more central. would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 27emzy57
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights, it was a lovely hotel with friendly staff. The location is perfect if you want to shop and eat out and has nice bars around it but is a little far out if you want to visit fishermans at night although the cables cars can easily bring you back. we were pleased with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Think twice...”
Reviews.Author: Bryan W
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many nice hotels around Union Square over the last 7 years - this is not one of them. Staff is not helpful and borders on being rude. Room was very small and bathroom is outdated. Bed was confortable but unfortunately in front of a window that rattles in the wind and covered with a blind that does not block the morning sun. I typically stay at a Personality Hotel, not sure why I strayed. Live and learn (and beware of Teena at the front desk!)

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Cerian E
Reviews.Content: It is fantastically close to Union Square so as far as location, we couldn't ask for anymore. The front desk weren't particularly helpful to issues that arose during our stay. This was a multiple stop holiday and every other hotel we booked, successfully put us in our requested separate beds. The Handlery tried to put us in a double and were not happy when we requested what we had booked. The bellboys were very helpful. The rooms are small and contain the minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Geoham69
Reviews.Content: Only yards from Union Square this excellent boutique hotel is a good place to stay whilst in San Francisco. We stayed 3 nights on our way to Honolulu, the hotel is of a very good standard, staff very helpful and efficent. Our 4th floor room was perfect for our needs and could not be faulted. The attached restaurant was also of a good quality and again the staff were attentive at all times. It was worth booking for evening meal as the restaurant is open to non residents and can get very busy. The situation of the hotel is such that you can easily walk to other restaurants and if you are relatively fit, walk to the financial district, chinatown, little Italy and Fishermans Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dougiet33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and found it to be very comfortable and it's in a very good location. Room was clean and tidy and bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Central to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: EJGnpa
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this boutique hotel in the afternoon and found the front desk to be very helpful. Went to the room, unpacked and suddenly there were loud noises from the street. The hotel across the road apparently had issues with past staff and they could demonstrate on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays for about one and a half hours in the afternoon and then Saturday morning at seven am. This had been going on for months. The Handlery is great but they should have told us about this noise. Fortunately we wanted to get up early on Saturday ... we did not have to use the hotel wake up system. The conceirge was very helpful and the location was great for restaurants, shopping and cable cars stops. We ate at the Daily Grill a few times and stopped in the bar as well. Interestingly we felt an earthquake one night while in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: aleator
Reviews.Content: I felt that the front desk personnel were at best corporate robots. In fact, they were dishonest and mean. My company reserved my room with a credit card. When I arrived, I used my ATM card (as I have stopped using credit cards) for incidentals. Upon entering my hotel room, my cell phone alerted me to a $500 charge on my debit card. Whoa! I wish I had been told that the whole balance for the room was going on my card. The front desk after an hour of conversation said to come back the next day to complete a series of faxes and phone calls. I was in The City to work not deal with hotels and banks. So, I then checked out of my room but was still charged for staying the night. They said that there was a penalty for canceling a reservation within 24-hours. I asked them to charge the credit card that held the reservation and not my debit card. No deal. They were not going to help me beyond taking one night off my atm card.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding trip”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvl42
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a great area, walking distance to lots of shopping. Remember when staying in San Francisco and taking your own car parking is expensive everywhere. Try to get a package deal with parking if possible. My husband and I felt the staff were very nice and the rooms nice and clean. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Close to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: ninama3
Reviews.Content: The best thing this hotel has to offer is proximity to Union Square. Other than that, not fabulous, but not horrible either. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I stayed for a week on business and everyone recognized me by the end of the week and said hello. The rooms are small and VERY basic, but passable. A bit on the noisy side, but that's the trade in for being so close to the city centre. Daily Grill is the restaurant attached to the hotel - they also do room service so the grub is better than expected for an average rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Jack775
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to San Francisco with three teenagers to attend a concert and we all thoroughly enjoyed the stay. The hotel was close to restaurants, shopping, our concert venue, and Union Square (of course!). The weather at the end of September was wonderful and there was plenty to do in the evening after the concert. We all felt very safe in this area and were able to walk to the concert. The staff at the Handlery was very accommodating. I would suggest you chose to include the parking fee in the price you pay for the room as parking is very expensive. I would recommend this hotel to families with teenage children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location which trumps the mediocre room.”
Reviews.Author: PamelainVictoria
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing so close to everything!! And for San Francisco not walking up a hill constantly to get to your hotel can be a definite plus. The theater district is just a short walk, amazing restaurants are nearby and shopping is like a block away!! The only thing it didnt have was an ocean view, but you cant have everything. Big negative was having the hotel Frank across the street on strike so early 7am we woke to a strike bullhorn. Not the Handlery's fault by any stretch but still would have been appreciated a heads up. We never seemed to get to the pool too many other things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel that's not too pricey”
Reviews.Author: DomfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Just off Union Square was a very helpful location, but right on the edge of "where the soup kitchens start". We had a great suite, supposed to be historic, which really meant not that up to date, but clean, smart and stylish and plenty of room for a family of 4. Massive cupboards, shared bathroom (within the suite) all good. friendly and helpful staff. Didnt use the pool, did use the car park - bit of a trek from there to the front desk reception. great place to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Our visit to The Handlery 26th-29th September 2011”
Reviews.Author: franandhow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at The Handlery for 3 nights from 26th September this year, after a long flight from London we arrived at the hotel. Hotel is an a fantastic position to Union Square. We stayed on 5th floor and the room was right by the elevator and next to the ice machine, but surprisingly we heard no noise or disturbance from either. We stayed in an Historic Queen, which was in the main building, the room was an ok size with a large bathroom. Room was very clean, apart from a 'make do' closet which was a little scruffy. Bed and pillows were too soft for us, but that is just my opinion. We visited the pool every day, but the trouble was there was no sun that time of year until just after 4, and it was boiling hot weather when we visited about 90 each day! There are lots of beggars as I was warned, but they were no problem to us. We purchased a 3 day Muni pass for $21 each, which worked out good value as the trams were $6 each way. We jumped in a taxi from the airport to the hotel, it worked out $55 each way with tip. Way TTTTOO many restaurants ALL great food, Cheesecake factory 2 mins from the hotel at the top of Macys, always good. Visited North Beach area one night, just jumped on a tram, off at North Beach, great choice for lovely pasta. Back to the hotel, front desk staff were ok, not overly friendly but ok, doorman was great, so friendly All in all a good clean 3 star hotel in a fantastic city. We loved San Fran, we will return. Thanks Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - OK place”
Reviews.Author: tnt-la
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the first week of August, 2011. The location is excellent - across the street from a cable car stop and walking distance to many restaurants and shops. Our room was in the second / back side of the hotel with a view of rooftops and other buildings. Room was comfortable, but a little hard to get to because of the various stairways we had to navigate. The concierge was terrible. I called ahead of time to get restaurant recommendations so I could make reservations - no one returned my calls. After checking in we went to the concierge desk to ask about restaurant recommendations and were told "I don't know what you like so how can I give you a recommendation" - nice. We ended up asking the gentleman at the front entrance and were given two wonderful places and the best way to ge there. Other than the concierge, the rest of the staff were nice and helpful, but we probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery San Francisco is top notch!”
Reviews.Author: smithkimberlyk
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel in the "heart" of San Francisco's Union Square. Short blocks to all shopping and restaurants. Very convenient, competitively priced, and a good value!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Greeby
Reviews.Content: Driving along geary street, the outside of the handery hotel strikes you as being old, in the fashion of many other san francisco buidlings. However, the moment you step into the lobby, a gentleman is there to stop you where you are to ensure that you don't have to pick up a single bag. The staff and very helpful and friendly. Our room was on the second side of the hotel and it is beautiful. It was a premier queen and I highly recomend it. There is a modern bathroom and seperate powder room complete with seat and fancy mirrors. There is also a nice wardrobe with the usual safe, bathrobes and ironing equipment. The main area of the room consists of two large and very comfortable queen beds, a modern study desk, flat screen TV and tea and coffee facilitys. However, the best part of these rooms is the view! there are floor to ceiling windows with views of O'Farrel street or Geary and I enjoyed just watching the hustle and bustle of San francisco from my room. Location is amazing, right in th middle of union square and right next door to macys. We visited fishermans wharf on the cable car and it is a very close walk. There is also a lovely pool, however, we did not use it due to the wheather being too cool. I highly recommend this hotel to both families and couples, this is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: keevs84
Reviews.Content: was very pleasantly surprised with this hotel, wasn't expecting very much but it really is lovely. Our room seem like one of the newer ones and it was nice, the windows and the like are a bit dated but it never bothered us, we were there to sightsee. Pleasently surprised that we got breakfast vouchers, we hadn't been expecting them and the breakfast next door really set u up for the day. Any of the staff we encountered where lovely and very helpful, housekeeping went out of their way to get us a travel plug and where in r room in minutes, I was expecting them to take their time, she even came in and helped me get the iron going, so hats off to her. Very central location for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely welcome”
Reviews.Author: deftlydefiant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of our honeymoon. Lovely welcome of fizz and snacks in our room on arrival and a follow up phone call from Mr Handlery after we had arrived - nice touch! We stayed in a premiere King on the 6th floor. With the patio doors open it was pretty noisy but with them shut you'd have never have known you were in the middle of the city! The room was lovely and large, kept super clean - the amenities such as hair dryer etc could do with a little updating but apart from that couldn't fault it. The staff were very efficient (quick check in/ out) but to be honest other than staying there didn't have too much contact with the hotel. The hotel is centrally located, near Union Sq and the cable car line which we used quite a bit. Would def recommend and if we come back to San Fran will stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Hgood1
Reviews.Content: I'm just returned from San Francisco, where I stayed at the Handlery Hotel. I was looking for a hotel in San Francisco that had balconies. Sadly, I smoke, but I never smoke indoors. I feel if I'm paying a good amount of money to stay somewhere, I feel I shouldn't have to be incovenienced to have to completely exit the hotel and go out onto the street in the middle of the night for a smoke. The Handlery does allow smoking on their balconies ONLY. Non-smokers, don't worry, the hotel prohibits smoking in their recently refurbished rooms. Unusual for San Francisco is the fact that the hotel has an outdoor swimming pool, which is large enough to do laps in. They also have a small gym. The hotel is connected to the Daily Grill, which is an upmarket restaurant chain. The restaurant has a good selection of breakfast items, from lox and bagels to eggs benedict. The turkey melts at lunch are delicious. Wasn't so wild about the burger, which I expected to be a little thicker and juicier, it was kind of on the thin side and dried out. They do have a great bar, I have to say, and great for meeting people. The hotel is well-situated next to Union Square, it's easy getting around. Not to mention, if you're taking the train into town from SFO airport, the Handlery is about the closest hotel to the Powell Street station. Don't waste your money on a cab, the train practically takes you to the doorsteps of the Handlery. I loved my sizeable balcony with patio furniture. I could sit outside, have a drink and smoke and watch the cable cars going down Powell Street. Make sure to ask for a room facing O'Farrell if you want a balcony and view of the cable cars. Ice machines on every floor as well as soda machines. Complimentary bottled water in the room and really liked that the room had an eclectric shoe shine which came in handy since I was going to a dressy event. Tony at the front desk was insanely helpful and helped me get a great room before check-in time. Strongly suggest if you are having an early arrival to call the hotel early, early that morning, as I did, to see if they can look out for you once the first room becomes available. If you ASK, they will try to accommodate. Ask and you shall receive, don't and you won't. The lobby was a good place for people watching, though not nearly as large a lobby as say the Hilton or the Marriott. Right behind the hotel is a Starbucks, big plus. Breakfast can be sent to your room by the way from the Daily Grill. I just found everyone at this hotel very helpful, and many went out of their way to help. I've seen complaints on tripadvisor from people harping on about the confusing maze of hallways getting from the old section to the new section of the hotel. Okay, trust me on this one, it's a crazy, isane, whiny complaint. There's nothing confusing about it at all, it's not difficult at all to get around the hotel. The complaint is just crazy. Some people have written that the hotel needs renovation. Well, I'll agree the corridors on the guest floors could be updated and more upmarket, but they were fine. As for the rooms, they have been renovated nicely within the last couple of years and the premium room features a separate boudoir area adjoing the bathroom so your wife can be applying makeup while you shower or use the toilet. The premium rooms have a couch and black marble-topped coffee table which was nice for entertaining guests: a drink in the sitting area and a nice sit out on the balcon--lovely. I didn't want to leave this hotel. It may be imperfect, but it's very homey, and I was sad to leave. I have to admit, as someone who works in film and TV, I really loved the video the owner has online. I clicked on expecting some brainless person saying just how wonderful the hotel is, but the owner does a comedy sketch where he insults the guests, it was hysterical and well-done, he should be acting. I guess I liked his gumption so much that I thought, I don't need to look anymore, I like this guy's spirit and sense of humor, I have to believe I'll have a nice stay, and a nice stay I had. I would definitely go back. Note to families, my premium king had the option of a connecting room. And for those of your watching your pocketbooks, the Handlery is consistently the best value in San Francisco. Truly. I researched and researched, no hotel of its quality ever matches their prices. For this stay I checked the Hyatt Regency which is not even at the center of town, and they wanted more than 550 a night for just a room. For 189 a night, in a very busy hotel week, I had a sitting area and balcony. Staying at the Handlery was kind of a no-brainer. It's not glitz and glamour, but it's a comfy place to stay, paces away from the American Conservatory Theater, the Powell Street cable car, and Union Square. I recommend it. Oh, one last thing, there are complaints on here about too much street noise which worried me...huh? I don't get it. My room was utterly quiet and I was facing the street not the interior courtyard pool. Not noisy at all. Slept like a baby. Nice Serta beds as well and great fluffy pillows, wanted to take them home with me. I had such a good sleep. Nice touch also, you don't have to bring toothpaste or a toothbrush, it's provided in the room, with good quality soap and shampoo. I think they should advertize this on their site. It would have prevented me scrambling for a TSA-approved size of toothpaste before leaving for SFO. This an eco-friendly hotel for those of you who care about the environment. The maids were all lovely. Comfy. Homey. I miss it already.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: londoner031
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the handlery so we obviously like it!! Staff are extremely pleasant & helpful at all times. The hotel is so central that it's easy to get around on the Muni transport or cable car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: spencer51
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is in a great location being just a 10 min walk from the Powell St BART station. Yeah, its an uphill walk but this IS San Francisco. Once settled in you are close to the main cable car stop and other public transport options and the tourist info centre in Market St. ( As well as the big Westfield shopping mall ) The rooms we had ( two couples from Australia ) we fairly small but quite adequate and clean. Great breakfast in The Daily Grill adjacent to the hotel . Our flight was not 'til 11pm on the day of checkout but we were able to store our luggage in a secure area so that we could do the bike ride across the Golden Gate Bridge , a definite must - do. Staff were freindly and helpful. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location in city centre”
Reviews.Author: judith14
Reviews.Content: San francisco is a magnificent and friendly city and the handlery a good place to stay at! There is a swimming pool, quiet rooms and in san francisco it is really an obligation to cycle the golden gate bridge :-)!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynn M
Reviews.Content: We loved the atmosphere of the Handlery and really appreciated staying in a family run hotel in the centre of town. Our room was large, light and airy, the staff were friendly and helpful - what more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, reasonable price, fading interior”
Reviews.Author: Donald C
Reviews.Content: I almost gave the Handlery 4 stars - the check-in staff and concierge were pleasant; I had a good online booking experience [including email follow-up]; there were some reasonable facilities (fitness room and pool); and our rooms were clean and kept well. However, the fading quality of the interior really made me plump for 3 stars. There is a pervasive atmosphere of an aging interior decor - from the musty corridors, brown brown beige brown colour schemes, one of the lifts being almost permanently out of service, and the lovely 1980s yellow marble in the lobby! Yum. We didn't sample any of the hotel's catering - when you are slap bang in the middle of SF there is little need! The WiFi throughout the public areas and the rooms was good in terms of signal strength, coverage, speed and contention. In-room entertainment was limited to some package of US cable / satellite channels (no HBO, BBC, movies etc) Still - for a good $30-$30 per night below nearby hotels with more modern refits and similar locations the Handlery prices itself appropriately. The fact that it was entirely full when we were there is also an indication that they aren't doing much wrong (although the fact that it was Fleet Week should be noted)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but good location”
Reviews.Author: Baystate2
Reviews.Content: As with all the downtown hotels, the Handlery really sticks it to guests during "Oracle Openworld" week. Minimum nights stays and overspriced rooms. When not during a convention, the Handlery is moderately priced and is in a great location. The bar / restaurant is also a rip-off with their drink (wine) prces and limited menu. If you stay anytime there's no Moscone event and eat at any of the great restaurants nearby you'll be quite pleased with the location, rooms and staff. Just avoid the place during Oracle Openworld. I really wish they would move Openworld to Las Vagas or Orlando so more people could afford to attend.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST”
Reviews.Author: LMF51
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Handlery on a few occasions now and always enjoy our time there - the staff (particularly Hermie) are always helpful and welcoming and we enjoy seeing them again. We had a lovely large and quiet room with a separate sitting area - this was in the historic part of the hotel - and Mr Handlery had arranged for a bottle of wine and a bag of snacks to be left for us - a very nice surprise. We would hope to visit again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BobB53
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little old fashioned (although there appear to be some new rooms at the back) but it is in an excellent location, just off Union Square and very close to the start/end of the cable cars. The bedrooms are fine but corridors are somewhat dated. Front desk staff are very efficient even if they appear rather brusque. Don't get a room low down at the front of the hotel as San francisco wakes early and is noisy !

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quigley61
Reviews.Content: The Handlery was a wonderful, smaller, boutique hotel. From the reception desk, the room, and location, it met every need. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine34684
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Handlery Union Square. We had a large room, very clean and nicely furnished overlooking the pool. We were in the newer section of the hotel and there was no noise at night. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The room had robes and was very well stocked with amenities. We stayed for 3 nights celebrating our 30th Anniversary and received a chilled bottle of champagne, a bag of snacks and a note from Mr. Handlery. Very nice touch. Customer service was number one. They know how to set themselves apart from the others and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Handlery!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Handlery yesterday. Our room was very good, a premier king with robes and a surprise gift bag and champage for our 25th anniversary. That was a lovely touch and we thanked Mr. Handlery himself. He was genuinely kind and glad to hear that we enjoyed the hotel. We had delicious breakfasts every morning. Just make a reservation the night before and there will be no wait whatsoever. We never had to wait once. The healthy breakfast is very good, as are the waffles and the full American breakfast. No complaints at all. The hotel is positioned in the heart of where we wanted to be - union square! I highly recommend the Alcatraz tour with the audio. You hear actual former inmates and guards speak. Very creepy and interesting all at the same time. We had one fancy dinner out at the Grand Cafe on Geary. It's a beautiful restaurant and the food was fantastic. I had the salmon and shared the chocolate pot de la creme. Delicious!!!!!! That was probably my favorite food during the entire trip. It was an amazing trip and I'd go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant needs better managment”
Reviews.Author: TwoTravellers34
Reviews.Content: The Handlery offers a unique location being a stones throw from Union Square. The service was pretty good but the Hotel itself is looking rather tired. We had no complaints with the house keeping services as the ywere pleasant and efficient. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. Although we did have to ask to be moved from a room on the road side as there were road works happening every day. We chose to prepay for breakfast and this create a slow service. Sometimes we had to wait 30 minutes before getting a table. With vouchers you only have three choices for breakfast. I would suggest if you stay at the Handlery that you book a morning table for breakfast and get a full menu offer. This way you will go straight to a table and will be able to order what you actually want. Front desk service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: fandangoMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 4th floor and paid $159 per night. Good value for a hotel right on Union Square and we'd paid up to $219 on the way to San Francisco for 3 star hotels so I guess it was good value however our room was a "historic" room which we found out meant "unrenovated". The room was fine, bed was very comfortable, our room faced the street and was a little noisy but manageable. The room was clean and comfortable which were the main considerations however other options right across the street or round the corner are Hotel Frank, Francis Drake or Villa Florence however that hotel is right on the trolley car route. The only thing that spoilt it was the 2 concierges we met who were determined to be aloof and provide the minimum of help, made us feel quite uncomfortable about asking anything at all with their world-weary eye-rolling. I hope their attitude improves.

Reviews.Title: “Very good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliemac1012
Reviews.Content: Large room, dressing gowns, even slippers on request. This was excellent accommodation right near Union Square, with very good breakfast included in the price, although a bit mean in not offering coffee and orange juice - it's one or the other and you pay extra for the more expensive juice. Very helpful staff, quiet room and small pool for the warmer months (if you get those in San Fran.) Would heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in SF, convenient for shops & restaurants”
Reviews.Author: sposa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Handlery for a girls night out of shopping and a birthday dinner. I asked for a room away from Geary Street and the reservationist at the front desk was very courteous and professional and I did indeed get a room away from the busy street. Great room, immaculate, comfy bed, and room service was prompt and friendly. There are 2 hotels and are connected by a walk way which was a bit confusing, but got the hang of it. I parked my car in their garage and that worked out very well, great service there also. I would definately stay there again. I booked my room through bookit.com and got a terrific price, much lower than my friends who did not use the inet for a booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: datc_manchester
Reviews.Content: Unless you like the younger crowd of Fishermans wharf then Union Square is right in the centre of things in SF and The Handlery is just 20 yards off the square. We found all the staff very helpful and seemingly happy to be there We upgraded on check-in to one of the newer rooms around the pool (201 I think) and it was large, well appointed and comfortable. The decor was modern in the bedroom. The only complaint I could have, if being picky, was the shower bath thing... I've never understood the point of putting a tiny bath (I'm talking about 40inches long) and then putting a shower above it with a curtain. Just put a shower unit there. Apart from that small point the room was great and had everything we needed including a coffee machine, hair dryer and iron. location really couldn't have been better with just short walks to Chinatown, the art galleries and trams / buses to all the piers and wharves. If you get breakfast vouchers when you check in walk around the right of the counter and into the daily grill to make a reservation for the next morning which will save you a 15 minute wait for a table. There are 3 included breakfast options and we tried all of them and were happy with them all.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Handlery many times. Rooms are always very clean and the entire staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: K Q
Reviews.Content: My family has been staying at the Handlery for over 40 years.......... and my husband and I the last 20 years. This year we went up for our 35th anniversary and we not disappointed at all. We stayed in the San Francisco Suite and it was great. So many amenities. We were greated by a very gracious gift package sent by Jon Handlery, the owner, upon arrival........flowers, champagne, wine and other goodies. Special treatment for a special occasion. Very appreciated and such a classy touch. The staff was always helpful with a smile. Our room was clean and very comfortable!! We had a great stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: smash413
Reviews.Content: the hotel has recently been refurbished and we were in the 'new part' which means a bit of a walk but our room was lovely. there is a pool which looked clean however we were too busy to use it!! location is amazing, I agree with the below comment about the concierge, he was 'short' with us as well, and the wait for the hotel restaurant was a little long, for breakfast i understand but we specifically booked a table for 9.45pm when we came back from Alcatraz as we knew we'd be starving but still weren't seated until 10pm as they needed to prepare the table (I thought the point of booking was that you bypassed this!) Overall i would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again, it felt upmarket, and our 'niggles' are comparatively small.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star except for the WiFi”
Reviews.Author: acpierce
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery September 18-20 for a conference. The conference was actually at another hotel but I thought this one looked nicer, was less expensive and I enjoyed the location. When I arrived, I was a little confused about parking, you have to go around the building to the garage. To check in, you have to walk back to the lobby. Not a big deal, but I would advise that you off-load your bags with the bellhop at the front, check-in and then pull your car to the parking lot. Check in was smooth and the staff was friendly. I had a premier room on the 7th floor with a balcony overlooking O'Farrell Street. I LOVED my room. It was spacious with a large main room, desk, living area and patio. The bathroom was average sized but it had an additional vanity outside the bathroom and a good sized closet. Not only was my room awesome, but I also got two free bottles of water and two $5 Starbuck's gift cards. I felt so lucky! I have two complaints. 1. The hotel free WiFi was horrible. I could not video chat, which is a necessity for me because my boyfrined is deployed to Iraq right now and this time is precious for us. Not sure what the hotel could do about the WiFi. 2. If you have noisy neighors, you'll hear everything. I had some loud people next to me and they were talking really loud really late. It almost sounded like they were in the hall, but they were in the next room. You can also hear toilets and doors closing. I realize it's a hotel and there will be noise and it's not the hotel's fault that those people were loud. But, I wish people had more respect...it was the middle of the night! You can also hear lots of street noise, but that dies down later in the evening. I was so pleased overall that when my guy comes back from Iraq, we are planning another trip here for pleasure instead of business. I am looking forward to coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sherry W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Near Union Square, trolley's, shopping, etc. The rooms are very nice and clean. This is an older hotel that has been refurbished very nicely. The help was exceptionally nice and helpful. A special thank you to Hermie who took great care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Quite satisfied with a couple of buts”
Reviews.Author: Silversox
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this Hotel but......there is no room service past 11pm (which is sometimes a problem when flexibility required), no ability to select some movies and the room was on Geary Street which is very noisy and the glass in the windows is single pane. In the middle of the night I sometimes felt like I was living the street buskers dream (or nightmare!!). On balance you couldn't ask for a better location. The only other thing my husband really wanted to say is the shower for him was like needles being thrown at him!!! Oh btw the concierge probably needs a holiday - a little short for me.

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: saltwaterTN
Reviews.Content: Get anywhere you need very safe in union square. first timers great hotel. Staff was very helpful can not say one bad thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: HopeOdell
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the heart of Union Square - excellent location! The rooms were updated, beds were comfortable, parking garage attendant was always available! It was very clean. Our room didn't have a view of anything but an alley and the high rise apartment building next to us but that was ok because we were there to shop and enjoy the city. We were only in our room late at night to sleep for a few hours before we were off again! The air conditioning was another weird situation. There was a thermostat on the wall set to 65 but it wasn't that cool in there and wouldn't turn down anymore. So we were a little hot at night. The only other thing that was weird was the way the building was made you had to ride one elevator walk outside through a breezway and take some steps before you could get to our room. It was like 2 buildings that they couldn't connect any other way. Overall, you see I still gave it a high rating. I was a satisfied customer!

Reviews.Title: “loved the bar”
Reviews.Author: alastair4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel on a trip around the USA. Having been to San Francisco once before we new we wanted to stay near Union Square and this hotel was perfect in this respect.The room we stayed in was quite old and small as was the bathroom and we looked out our window onto a brick wall. Apart from the location the real highlight of this hotel was the bar and restaurant connected to the hotel. I think we sat at this bar most nights, the service from the bar attendants was superb and very entertaining. We ate at the bar one night and I had the best burger I can remember. Breakfast was included in our rate and while the wait was a little long for a table in the weekend, which i guess is understandable, it was simple but enjoyable. If we come back we might look at other hotel options but would certainly come back to have a drink in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great base camp for San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Gusman68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated perfectly to get around San Fran. It was clean and the restaurant was of a very high standard

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: daz66
Reviews.Content: Good location at union sq and the food at the daily grill is very nice and worth trying. We were on honeymoon and they knew this, even though we were there just for a few days I expected a better room, we had no view what so ever and the bathroom was in need of updating, it all seemed so dark and gloomy. I had no idea until we stumbled it that it had a pool! And the rooms around the pool looked so much better, strange that they didn't offer any of these, as I said we wanted a nice room. Other than that the hotel is ok for a quick stop over. We visited the intercontinental and that was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Every year my wife and I decide to make a trip up to San Fran and usually we tend to stay around the Fisherman's Wharf area but this year we decided to change things up and stay at The Handlery. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Union Square in downtown San Francisco. From the time we stepped off the plane I decided to call the hotel for a direct but reasonable choice in transportation to the hotel. Immediately I was greeted by Jason an employee of the hotel. He gave me clear and precise choices without being biased over one or the other. Being a person who takes customer service and attention to detail very seriously, my wife was quite impressed with his knowledge of the city and its surrounding areas. As soon as I take a hotel shuttle to the hotel (very reasonable at $17 a person), we were immediately greeted by the bellman Hermie. Now we could tell he's been doing this a while as it seemed like he knew we were coming all along. Very friendly and very efficient. Then it was onto the Front Desk where Tony helped us out of a small jam. Tony gave me a small warning that the Hotel Frank had protests across the street and that may interrupt our sleep in the morning because we were facing the Geary side of the hotel. Knowing I didn't want to get woken up rudely by them he helped me move over to the Premiere side of the building so that we could a more comfortable stay. Great job for that. To our surprise a voice message from Jon Handlery the owner and GM of the hotel was waiting for us! He apologized for not being to meet us in person and that he wished us a wonderful stay in the city. I don't know about you folks but to me when someone from the top genuinely cares about the welfare of his/her guests, then that makes me want to come back again and again. The room was quite spacious with a singly king bed and we were able to overlook the outdoor pool (which is heated by the way!). Along with the usual amenities it was nice seeing a snack bag in our room as we were starving from our long trip from New York. Seeing a mini fridge in the room helped as well as we are not huge eaters and bringing back leftovers is a must. During the rest of the trip I wasn't able to interact with many other staff as I was consistently out exploring the town but I can tell you that everyone I did speak or interact with was very enthusiastic and it seemed like they loved what they were doing. The only thing I would say could use improvement, however, is their air conditioning system. Seemed like everyday it was quite hot inside of the room but the Front Office Manager Catherine, and Engineer Carmelo took care of us to make sure our room was in working order. Good to see an efficient bunch of employees. Overall this is the best hotel we've experienced in the San Francisco area so far. If you're ever in town be sure to check this place out as you can do anything and everything you want. Mr. Handlery you run a wonderful hotel and we can't wait to see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but it can get noisy.......”
Reviews.Author: AllanY60713
Reviews.Content: Checked in by friendly and efficient staff, concierge was very helpful. Having just come from MGM Grand in Vegas, the room size and bathroom was a little dissappointing but a good standard. Main issue with this hotel is the noise from outside. From around 7pm until 10pm we were 'treated' to a steel band which was very annoying. It is located on one of the main traffic streets and as such suffers from constant beeping, emergency vehicle sirens etc we were on the 7th floor out of 8 as well. Also the area can be a bit unsettling at night due to the number of homeless people around. Air conditioning in our room was also not that great and the windows had to be opened to let cooler air in. Bathroom only had a shower, was a bit small. On the other hand, it is centrally located for Union Square and the shopping district. Sightseeing buses within a 2minute walk which will take you to the main city attractions including Alcatraz (we couldn't get tickets for Alcatraz whilst we were here so make sure and book before you come!) and we got a complementary breakfast for each day we were there which was a welcome bonus. Choice of a cooked breakfast, cereal and fruit or waffles. The breakfast is served quickly by friendly staff. Dinner at the restaurant was also very nice and reasonably priced. 5 minute walk from the BART station, so easily get to it to go to the airport, was only $8.10 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but Quirky”
Reviews.Author: Philygirl4ever
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is right in the middle of Union Square right near all the greatest shopping. The hotel is a bit quirky as there are two parts to it with stairs separating them (making it very difficult to get your luggage up and down.) Be sure to ask the front desk if you will need to use the stairs (by the outside pool). You might need help with your bags. Clean and beautiful rooms. comfortable beds. All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: CEUS69
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Francisco having picked up my partner from SFO, we decided to stay at the Handlery Union Square...listed as a boutique hotel near Union Square we were intrigued since we typically stay at more upscale facilities such as the Sir Francis Drake and the International... Not knowing what to expect, I was pleased to find it within easy walking distance from my Amtrak bus shuttle (I took the Capital Corridor Amtrak to Emeryville, which then has a choice of three bus shuttle destinations: Ferry Bldg, Shopping Ctr. on Market, and Financial District). Thanks to Google maps, I found the "Shopping Center" destination to be the closest!). I just walked up Powell, took and left on Geary, and there was the big "H" sign for Handlery...easy! The check in was fast and efficient; I asked for an inside corridor room (I needed quiet from the street noise since my partner was flying back from Hong Kong and needed to rest) which the reception desk courteously accommodated and even upgraded the room! Although the room was characteristically "compact", (given its vintage era) it was efficient and updated with a large flat screen TV, marble bathroom, large closet with an in room safe (with a "key", imagine that?!) We were surprised by the heated pool that was located inside the hotel, but outdoors...loved it! It is open 8am to 8pm daily... Since my partner was bringing back our car from SFO skypark, she parked at the on-site valet hotel parking that is located around the block, also landmarked with a big "H"; please note, parking for hotel guests is $38/24 hrs, plus San Francisco's infamous "parking tax" of an additional $3.35...however, this price allowed us unlimited in/out privileges and the porters do pick-up and off-load your luggage to and from your car... Seriously, if you can avoid taking a car, I would recommend it since public transportation is fairly good, the problem only exists for you real "nightowls" who might find themselves stranded in the hood... There were lots of Australian visitors at the Handlery, they shared that the exchange rate is great (in their favor), and there are direct flights from Sidney....hmmmmmmm! Our room was quiet, very comfortable bed and the linen upscale; only downside, no refrigerator in our room...that's okay...plenty to drink within walking distance.... Overall, we very much liked our stay and would recommend it to our friends...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay..”
Reviews.Author: Tasha5390
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby was clean & spotless and staff were very friendly! Whilst checking in we were handed vouchers for free breakfast which gave you choice of 3 things on menu which was a bonus! We also inquired about wifi as we were under the impression you had to pay â‚¬9.95 a day, however we were given a voucher which enabled us to access wifi totally free! The room was tidy and clean. Had two queen size beds and was quiet considering that the hotel is on union square. In the rooms there was a tv, free safe and fridge! The location of the hotel was great for shopping as it was located right on union square and a short walk to the mall approx. 5mins or shorter down the hill. You could also catch the cable cars from side road near hotel which would take you fisher mans wharf etc these ruEn till either midnight/2am and cost approx $14 all day. We also had the Alcatraz & all loops bus tours (city sight seeing) which picked you up outside Macy's next to the hotel. In all I would defiantly recommend hotel was lovely and could not fault! Will hopefull return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A great base”
Reviews.Author: Shelley C
Reviews.Content: An excellent base as just a block away from all transport and obviously the Shops !!! bars and restaurants all around. There is a safe in the room which is always a bonus. The room was spacious and beds comfortable. Ignore the reviews about it being noisy - we had a room over looking the picketers over the transport system and didn't notice anything. It was a bit noisy to start with but being that a) we were in bed by 11 due to having a 7 year old and secondly compared to NY / London etc - the noise died down by midnight. The pool area was lovely and pool was warm even though outside wasn't so warm. Staff were all excellent. The only thing that really needs changing were the lifts (elevators) and Showers were a little but dated. other than that great value for money and great location !

Reviews.Title: “Under-promises and over-delivers”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne M
Reviews.Content: We came to San Francisco from Australia to celebrate our 25th Wedding anniversary and chose the Handlery based on a newspaper review. We were not disappointed. The Handlery under-promises and over-delivers, which we have found to be very rare in the hotel business. We arrived at our room to a find a bottle of French Champagne on ice and the flowers our daughters had sent us were placed in a lovely vase on a small side table. We also appreciated that the mini-bar was not stuffed with over-priced alcohol - we could actually keep our milk cool. Our room was near the central thoroughfare and pool which we found to be quite noisy, but when we requested a room change, it was done without us lifting a finger. We would like to make special mention of Tony (guest gervices) who seemed to be always on duty, and for whom nothing was too much trouble. He contributed enormously to our positive view of the Handlery and fabulous San Francisco. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: RollOnOctober
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights at the end of August '11 at the beginning of our holiday travelling on the Pacific Coast Highway between San Francisco and Los Angeles. Overall, we were very pleased with the Handlery. The rooms were clean and ours was quiet (we had booked a Premium room around the swimming pool and were very glad we did - I can imagine the rooms overlooking Union Square do get a lot of noise!). Our only 'gripe' was that we were expecting to overlook the pool, but actually we had a dismal view of a dreary apartment building next door! Breakfast vouchers were an unexpected bonus, and the breakfasts were actually some of the best we had during the whole holiday. Front of house staff were friendly and helpful - especially the concierge, one of whom recommended a good Italian restaurant and Scomers seafood restaurant (amazing dinner!!) and another who spent a lot of time explaining how to get the best out of public transport in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Roberto E
Reviews.Content: Very good location, Just literally walking distance from Union square, High end shops and restaurant. One of very few hotel that could accomodate 5 people in one room (Family Suites). Hotel old but very clean and updated. I will defintely stay in this hotel If I visit San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “Shoppers paradise”
Reviews.Author: JoanE_chinook
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery in 1996 and had very fond memories of the trip, so when we were planning a quick visit to San Francisco, we decided to return. The hotel is clean and the rooms slightly above average size. Front desk staff was pleasant and helpful (we changed rooms after the first night - we were right next to the elevator) and we didn't notice excessive noise in a full hotel (even the first night right next to the elevator) and I am a light sleeper. I really don't like paying for wifi but unfortunately, it seems most of the nicer hotels charge for it and the Handlery is no different. The cost of parking was truly out of line (almost $40 a day) and at the union square location, there are few other options. As for union square - it is centrally located and a great spot if you like shopping. Also a good taking off point for drives as it's not difficult to get to 101. It wasn't a great neighborhood for walking around, especially in the evening. We had a hard time finding a moderately priced restaurant within a 6 block walk. There was an above average diner around the corner. The biggest issue we had was with very aggressive pan handlers who quite literally followed us down the street hounding us and yelling at us in one case. We are not folks who dress extravagantly or otherwise draw attention to ourselves so I'm guessing it's just currently an issue in the Union Square area because of all the high end shopping. So overall - mixed emotions. Nice hotel but it wasn't a bargain, especially after adding on virtually another $50 a night for parking and internet. Accessible location but practically speaking, not a useful one for strolling around (unless you're there to shop).

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay when in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RobandCherie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Handlery for a total of 6 days in august while visiting San Francisco on the way to Tulsa for our son's wedding. We were very pleased with our room and the excellent service we received during our stay--nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The hotel is in a great position central all the main sites of union square, shops and places to eat. The staff were very helpful in organising tours for us and storing our luggage when we visited Yosemiti for 3 days. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Will0329
Reviews.Content: After almost getting mugged at 11pm at motel 6 in the tenderlion this place came to the rescue. My friend and I checked into this hotel the next morning after feeling unsafe at the motel 6 tenderlion the night before. We had perishables that needed to be refriderated and the staff at the handlery refirdgereated it for us untill the room was ready. The room was clean, well kept and this hotel supplies every tioletry you would need. There is also a mini fridge and coffee maker in the room. There is also a bussiness center. The area of this hotel is a prime part of town. You cant beat that. The price of the room wasnt bad either. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Room - Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: jctaz85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Handlery for four nights on our recent vacation. We had been debating whether we should stay in Fisherman's Wharf area or Union Square. We were so happy with our decision to stay here! There are so many stores, restaurants, bars coffee shops and things to see/do in this area, especially at night, which was perfect for us. Upon check-in, we were struggling to find our side of the building (the hotel is actually two separate hotels combined in one, so potentially tricky to navigate) when a very friendly man who worked for the hotel approached us and asked if we needed help. He led us all the way up to our door - and it turned out he was the GM! We were both blown away but that gesture and it definitely set the tone for the fantastic service we received here. The concierge desk was very helpful in helping us plan our daily excursions and which modes of transportation to use. The rooms were great. The beds were a little uncomfortable, but nothing that would deter a future stay. Other than that we had absolutely NO complaints. We had a premium room with a nice contemporary design. It was large and a very comfortable fit for us. The vanity area was a DREAM for me getting ready in the mornings. The room was on O'Farrell and so needless to say there was a lot of street activity during the day and at night, but the second we closed out balcony door it was almost silent. The only thing we could hear were the fire trucks or police car sirens, but it didn't really phase us. We would definitely come back to the Handlery in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location and great service”
Reviews.Author: TheButchers2011
Reviews.Content: To kick off our honeymoon we stayed at the Handlery Inn at Union Square. We booked it in advance and we didnâ€™t know too much about it to be honest. Some of the reviews on trip advisor worried us prior to staying at the hotel, however after staying at the hotel we feel some of the reviews are unfair and picky. Prior to our arrival I had contacted the hotel to advise of our recent wedding and that our honeymoon would begin at their hotel. On our arrival we had a room upgrade, we had a bottle of champagne and sweets and a note from the CEO of the hotel group congratulating us on our recent marriage, this was nice and a personal touch. The hotel doesn't look fantastic from the outside but the interior is nice and smart. Our room was large enough and the bed was comfy. The bathroom was ok but the bath was very small. The location of the hotel was awesome as you are 15m from Union Square where there are loads of shops and great places to eat. Peets coffee and tea is round the corner and you can get a proper brew from here. Also Market Street is close by where you can get the cable car and buses from. I think we would stay at this hotel again should we return to San Francisco, thank you to the staff of The Handlery Inn for making our honeymoon start nice and smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great staff and amenities”
Reviews.Author: mikekb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery Hotel for 2 nights with friends while we explored San Francisco then for another 2 nights with my wife and toddler. We had a family suite. I was very impressed with the quality of the hotel and the helpfulness of the staff. I had dislocated my shoulder mountain biking and the front desk and concierge were always attentive. The staff at the Daily Grill were patient and helpful while I fed my toddler breakfast with one arm and the cleaning staff were likewise friendly and kind to a curious little toddler bothering them. I will be staying at the Handlery Hotel on my next trip to San Francisco. My only issue was with a little drumming noise coming from the street (which was quickly diagnosed and dealt with).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, conveniÃ«nt and THE best conciÃ«rge”
Reviews.Author: Love_leaving
Reviews.Content: As a family we stayed at the Handlery. After a long and tiring flight reception was very friendly and and the bell boy helped us swiftly to our room. We had booked a premium room and it was roomy, comfortable, clean and luxurious. The only down turn was that our room was next to the elevator, which was a bit noisy. Fortunately it was not to disturbing and we all slept well in the comfortable beds. We particularly want to thank concierge Ed Zappia. After we lost our voucher for a bus tour he mediated with the tour operator and made it possible for us to go after all. With that he saved a considerable part of out stay in San Francisco. Great job Ed, you saved the day for us, thanks a million! The hotel is conveniently close to wonderful Union Square and the cable cars. If we ever return to San Francisco we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: louisjam
Reviews.Content: Came here on the recommendation of friends, who stayed here a few years ago and were also staying in a nearby room when I was there. Hotel has been there awhile, but well maintained overall. We stayed in the premier rooms in back that looked out over the pool. Room was large. Bed was comfortable and the balcony was a nice touch. The pool was old school deep and crystal clear. Generally very satisfied with my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ....”
Reviews.Author: AMK50
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. It's just around the corner from the tram stop to Fishermans Wharf and is also close to the shops and some good restaurants. The staff were friendly and the hotel generally clean. My major complaint was with the size and location of our triple room - firstly, it wasn't large enough to swing a cat, secondly it was very dark and finally it was situated so close to the kitchen vents that the room constantly smelled of cooked/fried food! Having said that we didn't visit SF in order to sit in our room all day so the room being so small was more of an inconvenience rather than a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - especially if you are a SF Giants Fan”
Reviews.Author: CCHandle
Reviews.Content: We went for our 25th wedding anniversary but frequently stay here. Check the hotel web site because they often run specials. We also have booked the Tony Bruno special for Giants fans, and because it was our 25th they gave us a lovely bottle of wine. This time we had the breakfast special included, which is in the American Grill next door, which is a very nice venue. The rate often includes parking that allows in/out priviledges, however, the location is so great, you won't have to drive around much. The American Grill is quite good and has a good happy hour menu and drinks. Lefty O'Douls next door has great "to go" sandwiches if you are headed to the ball park. You can take food and drinks into ATT park - no glass or aluminum.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: nabestag
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 and traveled to San Francisco from Aug 27 to Sep 4. The Handlery provided very nice accomodations and an excellent, central location in the city. It is literally surrounded by restaurants, bars and shopping. Public transportation is always close by (although taxis are exceptionally difficult to obtain). The hotel itself is clean, well kept and the staff is friendly and helpful. The blackout curtains are amazing. This is very important for difficult sleepers as some in my party were. The on-site restaurant â€˜Daily Grillâ€™ was actually very good. Excellent food, great portions and very reasonable prices. There is a fitness room as well but it is extremely bare-bones with some cardio equipment and a single bench. Outdoor pool is heated and a nice addition to the facilities. All in all, I would recommend this hotel as a comfortable, clean place to stay while exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Scolli01
Reviews.Content: Tis hotel is a gem in the heart of the city. We had a chance to stay in one of the pool side rooms that was like a little oasis. Being able to have a sun drenched afternoon poolside in the city was a welcomed relief from countless hours of sightseeing. The rooms were really clean but could use an freshening up to modernize them. The entire staff at the hotel were very accommodating and really helpful with our requests/questions. We'll definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel centrally located in Union Square. Room was comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: SW-NewJersey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights with my family in late August 2011. The room had two double beds and we had enough room to roll in an extra cot for my third child. Comfortable and clean, but a little small for my family of 5. There was a small beverage refrigerator in the room and one TV. The pool is located on the 2nd floor between the two buildings that comprise the Handlery. The hotel is centrally located in Union Square and is very easy access to the stores and restaurants that are all over this area. Union Square has a mix of very upscale stores, as well as more common chain stores. It reminded us of midtown Manhattan, NY in terms of stores with cable cars and munis passing through regularly. We did not try the Handlery's restaurant as the area has quite a few options for meals. Streets are congested in the area however, so the included valet parking (negotiated in my room rate) was a good option. We did take the car out on the weekend when parking in San Fran is much easier than during the weekdays, when we opted to use the Muni system.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, cute rooms, small shower”
Reviews.Author: ec1253
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of august with my boyfriend. We originally booked a petite room, but upon arrival we were upgraded to a bigger room with two double beds, which was a nice surprise. The room was really clean and very nice, but the shower was extremely small and it was difficult to take a shower without flooding the whole bathroom. We were given a room facing the street and it was somewhat loud at night. This didn't bother us at all because we're used to all the noise in NYC, but it might be annoying for people unused to city noises at night. The location was absolutely perfect for sightseeing, especially if you're a tourist without a car, and it was really nice to get back to such a welcoming staff and room in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpotts2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights. Everything was great - upgraded us to a Queen from a double - but got a wheelchair accessible room - didn't mind. It was interesting. Worried that someone might need it - would have gladly moved if they did. Good clean well run hotel. Have stayed many times and plan to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: adricka
Reviews.Content: Handlery is nice hotel with nice staff. Your location can't be any better. Right in the heart of San Francisco! Be prepared that due to taxes and fees your final check can be significantly higher as you assumed it to be. Price is bit too high, but remember you are paying for hotel location. Pool is nice, rooms are spacious and don't forget to take sauna which is fantastic relax after the long day in the busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: welingtonanna
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean modern room. Very friendly staff. Very handy location. Excellent breakfast. No complaints whatsoever. Staff member Yulia extremely pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, welcoming, definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: RedBearJ
Reviews.Content: This place is a charming boutique hotel right off Union Square and in walking distance to Chinatown and SOMA and there are some great little places right there on the block. The concierge and staff are gracious and welcoming and although we didn't use most of the amenities they offered, it was ample for a week-long get-away. We had a King room in the newer section, which they said was nicer than the older front areas. I could see down from the balcony into one of the smaller rooms and it looked cozy. My only issue was the low water pressure up on the 7th floor and there was no exhaust fan for the bathroom. Other than that, it's almost more convenient to come in the back of the hotel at O'Farrell St. than to weave your way through the front and up and around to the back half.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: retiredgourmet
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at this beautiful and busy hotel and found it as near to perfect in location, amenities, and service as one could possibly hope for. Very popular with international tourists and their families. One of the few in the Union Square area to offer an outdoor and charming pool and patio area. Concierge and bellman service is excellent. Premier rooms are quieter and come with breakfast vouchers at an adjacent restaurant and free internet.. Voucher breakfast just adequate and limited selections available, but you will want to save your appetite, and cash, for dinner at one of the nearby gems like the Farralon anyway. But make a reservation the night before for breakfast as the wait can be long. Valet parking is not as expensive as some hotels in this area and is fast and polite. There is a handicapped type lift between lobby area and the premier section rooms that is slow, but avoids dragging your luggage up one flight of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaurenHuey2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easily accessible to all the sites, in a great location. However I think I would have just paid the extra money to stay at the Hilton or the Sheraton. The hotel room was supposed to have air conditioning, and we couldn't get the temperature to go down so we ended up opening the window anyways. My husband and I only stayed one night, and the next morning we were leaving for Las Vegas, we checked out of the hotel at 6am. I had written a post card for my 7 year old nephew, and I asked the front desk associate if there was some where I could purchase postage, the front desk associate said he would take care of it, the concierege didn't return until 7am, my husband handed him one dollar to cover the cost of the postage along with the post card, a week letter my nephew never received his post card. So, overall it was an average hotel, but next time I will just pay the extra 50 dollars to stay at the Hilton or Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: joo j
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Fran and after going through many hotel reviews and rates, I chose The Handlery. My girlfriend and I stayed in a Premier King room with a city view. It can get kind of loud, but not too loud. We were both fine with the room. When we did check in they did offer to move us to a higher room where the outside noise would be lower, but after checking into our room we were quite happy with it. The room was clean. Thats pretty much all i need to say. A clean room can make or break the whole stay. Housekeeping was very nice as well. Concierge was very informative. Knows a lot of places/things/sights to go/do/see I know this shouldnt really matter but the tv channels only had basic channels!! its ok though as we were out in the city most of the time. The location is great!! Minutes away from Chinatown and the shopping districts. Lot of great places to eat nearby. Overall our stay here was very nice and i would gladly stay at the Handlery again next time i visit San Fran. Thank you Handlery

Reviews.Title: “Great position, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stormydog101
Reviews.Content: We booked in at the Handlery just off Union Square in San Francisco on the strength of positive reviews from other TripAdvisor users - and we weren't disappointed. The position of the hotel, in Geary Street about two minutes walk from Union Square, is fantastic. The Cable Car to Fisherman's Wharf runs from the corner of the street (though our advice would be get up a bit early, and get on the Cable Car at the bottom of Powell Street. The earlier you get there the shorter the queue, and it's still less than a four minute walk from the hotel!). Great shopping nearby, a huge range of places to eat, Union Square is a brilliant place to people watch, and transport connections to this part of town are great. Our room wasn't huge, but plenty big enough for the two of us. Bed was comfortable, service was impeccable but still friendly and the hotel was spotlessly clean throughout.
