Nice pool but we didn't have time to use it. We've seen comments about car parking - but to be honest, why would you? We bought a Clipper ticket and loaded it with $40 when we arrived at the airport - and that got us absolutely everywhere we wanted to go, and the Handlery's central location gave us access to buses, cable cars, the BART and trolley buses which took us everywhere. If we're lucky enough to come back to San Francisco, we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent choice for a Union Square location."”
Reviews.Author: Doris H
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on its proximity to Union Square as well as the on-site parking garage. I was very pleased by the cleanliness and updated decor. The room was about twice the size of the last queen-size room I had at another "boutique" hotel in the area, so that made my 3-day stay more pleasant. The weather was so nice I even got to enjoy their swimming pool - which is sheltered from the wind that often blows down the Geary Street corridor. My package included breakfast in the adjoining restaurant, and it was nicely prepared and tasty. All in all, I would definitely recommend The Handlery to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: plipp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - close to everything we wanted to do (shops, restaurants, transit). The pool area was like a little oasis in the noisy, busy city. We had one of the larger rooms with a balcony and it was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chelsie N
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of downtown San Francisco, this hotel experience by far exceeded my expectations! The staff was tremendous and the Daily Grill (connected to the hotel) offered amazing food! I highly recommend the Handlery Union Square Hotel! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: QTravelMayo_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in great condition. The room was spacious and comfortable. The location is perfect, right beside union square.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for many, great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Demonsbarnyard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery with two small children and had a good room although with no view but quiet and comfortable beds. Service was excellent including organising a doctor and letting us back into the room after checkout because we forgot our travel documents. It was clean, the pool great for the kids. Only negative point is breakfast and food in general next door at the daily grill. The vouchers get you a very average breakfast, service is not efficient (impossible to get hard or soft-boiled eggs) and the dinner we had there was very average. If possible have breakfast somewhere else. Otherwise great location for tourism and shopping. We would go back to the Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: NEUK70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery for 5 nights in July. The hotel was probably the most expensive I have stayed in but was worth paying for the great location. I was in a premier room which was perfectly adequate, very clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in. I didn't have any issues with the hotel in any way. On the odd occasion when I spoke to the concierge they were extremely helpful. One instance was when I enquired about getting a taxi. An employee then went outside and started blowing the most unusual sounding whistle and suddenly a taxi came racing up to the hotel entrance. I had never seen anything like it in my life and thought it was so funny. Was very impressed. Thanks to the short guy with the glasses:) didn't get your name. In my opinion this city is out of this world. I loved every minute and wish I'd planned a longer stay as there was so much to see and do. I would certainly stay in this hotel again. Loved the hotel and loved San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Union Square Hotel was in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Robert K
Reviews.Content: Handlery Union Square Hotel was in a great location near to all the action and Chinatown. The room was clean and well maintained although you could hear the noise from the street below. The hotel gave us breakfast vouchers with three meals to choose from â€“ American breakfast â€“ waffles â€“ or a muesli type dish with fruit. The hotel was booked through an agent and I think the breakfast vouchers are an add-on so you would have to check with the hotel or your travel agent. If you are on holiday this hotel is in a good location with munis and cable cars two minutes away. Car parking is expensive in San Francisco but public transport is good and fun to use. A city pass booklet is a great way to save money. when we bought them it was $69 per book. This gave us free entry to lots of attractions such as the science museum, art museum, sealife centre, and a trip around the bay. A ride to Fishermans Wharf was $6.00 on the cable car one way but free if you had the book.

Reviews.Title: “Very central for SF”
Reviews.Author: J2PRX
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a mystery hotel and we were pleased with the result as it was perfectly situated for our fairly quick visit. Getting to the hotel proved difficult - we could see it but the one way systems kept pushing us away! However, we eventually worked it out and parked outside. No-one there to help or give info about parking and had to go to reception to find out. At that point our bags were collected and we were directed to the garage ( expensive but then not surprising in central SF)! Given room upgrade from small double to larger double. Room lovely and quite adequate. Modern decor, clean although the bathroom was tiny! Staff weren't particulary friendly or helpful ( surprised that the concierge was not prepared to arrange theatre tickets and gave inaccurate details as to where the theatre was). Would have appreciated free Wifi in the room at this level of hotel. Overall the hotel is ideal for a city break, handy for Union Square, shops, restaurants, cable car, galleries and general sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visitor”
Reviews.Author: Rick G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past and will continue to do so in the future. From the moment I made my reservations to the moment I left, The Handerly met and/or exceeded all expectations. The valets were helpful with directions ( I'm from Southern California and this is a crazy city to drive in ) Front Desk at check in was quick and efficient and the Concierge was helpful in directing us to the Muni to go to the Giants game & all right next to Leftys! The Daily Grill is nice too but it's Leftys for me when I'm in town. As I said previously, I will stay here again, a great hotel at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, if only the staff were more helpful.”
Reviews.Author: TXRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Older property in Union Square; well maintained. Good location, right on cable car line, just a few blocks from Market. Small but comfortable rooms (we had two rooms w/ one queen size bed each). Mini-fridge, big screen TV, coffee maker. Shower, no tub. Wi-fi charge is absurdly expensive, as is parking - $38 / night (not uncommon in San Francisco). Neither the front desk staff nor the concierge were very helpful with advice and directions. The concierge was particularly unhelpful when we asked for information on Golden Gate Park and its museums, attractions. ("No printed information exists," was his response.) However, the bellman was very amiable and helpful. Parking garage is one street over (behind the main entrance), so make note if you're driving in. So-so fitness center. Didn't try the attached restaurant. We got a rate on Hotwire on this property, so a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Why Would you Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: JuneauGirlNevada
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in dozens of San Francisco hotels over the years, but never the Handlery, including the Hilton, Marriot, Sir Francis Drake, and the Westin. The Handlery is my new FAVORITE. Super efficient and friendly staff. Fantastic location - less then a block from Union Square - but unbelievably "quiet" rooms - very hard to find in the heart of The City. Our room did not have a view - but who cares, we were in San Francisco to get out and tour, shop, the Orpheum and the Giants game. This will be the first place I check for future visits to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: pualani4
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of everything, we loved it. Room was clean, nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Location-Location-Location”
Reviews.Author: Goesoutalot
Reviews.Content: Located in the perfect place right off Union Square the Handlery provides creature comforts at a reasonable price. This is Old World Charm (smaller rooms, windows with blinds, etc) but with updated furniture and comfort. Our room had a refrigerator and coffee maker a comfortable queen bed and a nice size desk to connect to the internet (extra cost) and work space. It was a bit unusual not to have a chest of drawers for clothing but with only the two of us we were fine with the closet and compartment in the buffet with the refrigertor and coffee maker. Next door is the Grille restaurant and even better one more door down is Lefty O'Doole's with terrific baseball nostaltia and the best breakfast deals in the Union Square Area. You are only steps from the Powell lin cable cars, an easy walk to China Town, all the designer shopping you can imagine and even within distance of the ferry's on the Embarcadaro.

Reviews.Title: “a nice place with charm”
Reviews.Author: apeakhiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an interior room for one night. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The hotel is well located near the center of the union square area. We liked the neighborhood. The hotel is quite old, but that just seems to add to the charm, as it is well kept. We had problems with a nearby room making a lot of noise late at night.. one call to the front desk.... problem solved. We booked online (without knowing the hotel when we booked) the price did not include breakfast or parking, but it still ended up being a good deal. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Guitar_mark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in early august 2011. Not being a native, driving in a big city was a bit daunting, which didnt help when told at the reception that although I needed valet parking I had to drive from the front to the back of the hotel, I would have assumed valet parking was what it said on the tin, apparently not. The concierge staff were helpful when we needed them as were the bell boys. The hotel is reasonably clean as was the room. The bathroom was too small and the room around the bed was limited. The hotel is in need of some modernization as it is looking tired. The only plus side is the location. Close to union square and all the main shops as well as Westfield shopping centre which is only 4 blocks away. The cable car turnaround is 3 blocks away downhill or it can be picked up on the corner of union which is about 150 yds away. 3 star is about right but having stayed in better 3 star city hotels, I wouldn't choose this one again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Klte11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of many in a great location close to most things. Having booked two double rooms three months ahead, on arrival only one room had been booked. They found this was an error on their part and unfortunately the other room they gave us had two single beds. Rooms were clean and serviced promptly. The complimentary breakfasts were wonderful with only a short wait for tables. We had one evening meal on our last day in the dining room which was okay. Service in the dining room was prompt but all meals were slow in coming to the table. We also had to ask for water as this was never offered. We had a lovely stay and would return if I could get a larger bed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Valet Service & Mold in Room”
Reviews.Author: Ken34
Reviews.Content: We decided to post a review mid-stay. We have not completed our stay here yet, however, I must say that this hotel does not come close to meeting our expectations. We even feel a bit uneasy giving a bad review because we are not picky travellers and have never had an experience like this. Throughout this California trip alone, we have stayed in 1-star motor inns, 4 star upscale hotels, and others in between. We have not had anything bad to say about any of our previous acconomodations, let alone what we have already experienced here. Our first encounter was with the valet parking service gentleman. I asked him if I could park my own car in the space as we had a lot of luggage that would require multiple trips. We also had some loose items that we wanted to pack away before unloading. He could barely speak English and just kept saying "NO, I PARK, NO I PARK, YOU NO PARK". We come from Toronto and are very used to multi-culturalism, however, we could not understand a word he was saying. I again asked him if I can park myself, and he said "NO, YOU PAY $38 PER NIGHT AND I PARK". We unloaded all of our luggage onto the driveway and gave him the keys. If he would have explained it's valet-only, it would have made more sense to me. He could also have offered to get someone to assist us with our bags. From there, we were standing in the parking garage without any idea of how to enter the hotel or reach the elevator. Very poor service and a frustrating/awkward conversation. Especially when it's your first impression. The front-desk lady was very pleasant and professional. She promptly gave us a run down on the hotel as she quickly checked us in. However, when we got to our room and turned on the A/C, it started dripping down water. Unfortunately, the vent is on the ceiling right by the door so we got the moldy water on us. Yes, moldy water. Looking up into the vent, there were green and brown spots of mold from where it was consistently dripping down. We called the front desk and the same lady apologized and set us up with our new room. A guy came to the room, apologized, and asked me if I tried to clean it off. I found that interesting as it seemed as if he was suggesting the hotel guest should attempt to clean mold off the AC unit. For the record, I did attempt to clean it off but it was caked on. The good news is that we are currently in the new room that is mold-free as expected. I'm sure these instances are isolated based on the other reviews. It just doesn't make sense how you can have a valet guy that barely speaks English and is rude and does not even point you in the right direction or offer help. Additionally, having a customer pay $150+ per night to have mold and water drip on them as soon as they open their room door? We are not ones to complain, however, our 1-star motor inn back in San Diego trumps the service here at the Handerly in San Francisco! Perhaps we just caught a new guy on the job and had bad luck on the room allocation, however, we cannot give this hotel a positive or even adequate review. It has left a very bad taste in our mouth and we will not be reccomending this hotel or returning.

Reviews.Title: “A Happy Ending!”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddy73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a trip to California to celebrate our 35th anniversary. We spent the last two nights at the Handlery Hotel in San Francisco. THANK YOU John Handlery! You and your staff did not miss a thing. We liked that this hotel is right in the heart of Union Square, only a block to great restaurants and shopping. You can easily catch public transportation to go to China Town, Fishermans Wharf and many other SF sights. The concierge and staff were all helpful and friendly and made several wonderful suggestions on where to go. We loved our room, it was in the premier section and was decorated nicely. It faced the pool but was still "fairly quiet" during the day, and very quiet at night. The king size bed was as "heavenly" as the Westin's (we stayed at earlier in the week in a different town). The bathroom was spacious and my wife liked the separate make-up area/vanity outside the bathroom. The restaurant next door was also very good... OK more like excellent. It's called the Daily Grill and the food is delicious, the service is prompt and professional, and the drinks will make you dizzy. When we return to San Francisco for our 40th anniversary... we won't consider any other place but The Handlery Hotel. One last thing... thanks for the bag of snacks in our room... it was the perfect thing to have in the afternoon after a road trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACHCalgary
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a good central location for what we wanted to see. Very easy access to cable car, trolley, and BART for travellers without a vehicle. Service was friendly and helpful. The room was one of the smallest hotel rooms, I've ever seen, but we got a great deal for the area and the room was inside facing so avoided a lot of the street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: michdas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery Union Square Hotel on my first visit to San Francisco. It's a great hotel for first-timers as it's conveniently located right in the middle of Union Square (close to all transportation with shopping right outside). My travel companion and I stayed in a smaller room, but it was charming, clean, and just the right size for us (we really only returned to the room to sleep at night). It had a cozy bedroom feel, and it was quite soundproof. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, from check-in to check-out, and the concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable when it came to directions and public transit schedules. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hopefully we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: svl58
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at this hotel. Everyone from the bellmen, the front desk, housekeeping to the coneirge were extremely helpful and had great tips regarding the city! We were made to feel like royalty by the treatment we received.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTravelers82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights here during our honeymoon. We arrived at 11:00 a.m. and were able to check into our room even though check-in isn't until 3:00. Our room was a little on the small side, but had everything we needed. The fridge in the room was handy! The housekeeping was well done each day. We found that the prices for breakfast at the Daily Grill were a little on the pricey side, but there are several diners nearby that offer a decently priced breakfast. Overall, a good location in Union Square with great service. Note that free Internet is ONLY available if you are staying in the Premier section, otherwise it is $10.00 a day.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Turtle021
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Handlery after choosing it because of its previous good reviews and we were not disappointed. Having mentioned this was our silver wedding celebration when we booked, Mr Handlery left us a personal note with a bottle of champagne in our room. The room was a good size and had everything we needed. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We walked out of the hotel into Union Square and were ideally placed for shopping, touring or taking the cable car. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All I could ask for”
Reviews.Author: golf4fun08
Reviews.Content: It had been a long time since I had stayed in San Francisco and since I was taking my daughter and two teenage granddaughters for their first time, I wanted to make sure that their hotel stay was special. So, based on the reviews for the Handlery and the personal responses from Jon Handlery I booked this hotel for our stay. I also e-mailed Mr. Handlery before we went letting him know how impressed I was with his personal responses and asking which room he would recommend for my family. He responded right away, gave me the recommendation and then asked for the ages of my granddaughters so he could have something in their room to remember San Francisco. When we checked in at the hotel, the clerk informed me there was a note on our reservation instructing the staff to call Mr. Handlery when we arrived. As soon as she called him, he came out to personally welcome us to the hotel. I have to say that this made all of us feel very special. Also, as we were checking in, our bags were loaded on the luggage cart by Hermie. Before he showed us to our room, he gave my daughter a map marking the areas we should avoid, especially for two teenage girls. Don't misunderstand, this hotel is in a fantastic location, close to shopping, restaurants, cable car, etc. but he wanted to make sure that the girls didn't venture into unsafe areas. We stayed in the premier section of the hotel and it was wonderful. We choose a room facing the street so the two girls could see the city lights at night. Surprisingly enough the room was quiet. The new windows really do block out the street noise. We found the room to be spacious, clean, and very comfortable. With two teenage girls we all appreciated that the vanity was outside the bathroom. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the Daily Grill next door was a plus. Thank you Jon Handlery and all the staff for making this such a special trip. Oh, and yes, there was a bag of goodies in our room for the girls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, location and swimmingpool”
Reviews.Author: Jacky61
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Handlery Hotel for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of it. Our room was very large, clean, and big enough for a family of four. The room was located at the side of the swimmingpool and therefore very quiet. The swimming pool is nice, big and sunny and that in the heart of San Francisco. The location of the hotel could not be better, close to Union Square, the cable car, restaurants, shops etc. The staff was nice and friendly, but not more than that. We definitely would return to the Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, good food and staff but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: saffy55151
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around for a long time, but starting to look like it and sound like it. We were told at reception that we had "a quiet room", having stayed in countless hotels I knew this meant- somewhere within the bowels of the hotel, no windows. But surprise there was a window looking out to an internal working area. The main problem here was the noise of the main air con unit. These older hotels can be great but they need to keep maintenance up. VERY good central position, but would rather walk a bit further for a more modern hotel.. Staff wonderful, breakfast very very good..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: wanderabout
Reviews.Content: We were given a large sized, pool side room with a very comfortable king bed. The room was spotlessly cleaned each day and furnishings were in good shape. For the kids the heated pool, with direct access from the room, was a definite highlight. The Handlery is fabulously located just off Union Square between Geary and O'Farrell Sts., the Powell St. cable car turnaround and BART station 2 blocks south. The reservation desk and bell staff were very helpful and courteous. The only drawback, but this is true with all in-town hotels, is the usury parking fee ($38/day + tax), so try to get into town without a car and walk or use the Muni and taxis to get around. Highly recommend and a excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, felt like "old America", overall very good.”
Reviews.Author: yen-chi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the hotel. Was basic hotel with good service and excellent location. The city was very windy when we were there so good idea to bring a light jacket. Rooms were on the small side and bathrooms were slightly dated. Sometimes a little outside noise was heard but did not deter us from a good night sleep. I find Internet charge is quite expensive in the US. Breakfast was really good and was included in the room rate which was great. Please beware of the nearby electrical/tourist shops as they try to charge you extortionate prices for items like travel adaptors(I got stung the 1st day). Shopping is excellent in Union Square and more than plenty of eateries to choose from. San Fran was fantastic and this hotel was good value in a good location. I would stay again if I were to return which I hope is soon!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Spacious.”
Reviews.Author: MREL7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Handlery Union Square for 4 nights. This hotel is in a good location - right in the heart of Union Square for some shopping. You can easily catch public transport if you are wanting to go to Lombard Street or Fishermans Warf from accross the street. The restaurant attached to the hotel is called 'Daily Grill' and offers good food and a nice atmosphere. We had breakfast vouchers included in our package deal when booking. Staff are friendly and courteous both in the hotel and restaurant. The manager of the restaurant was easy to approach and was kind to assist me when I had a breakfast query. The staff in the foyer have maps and happily direct you to places and offer suggestions on things to do in San Fran. The hotel is CLEAN, comfortable and quite spacious. My friend and I stayed in a room with two Queen Beds and we were very suprised with the amount of space we had. The bathroom is tiny, but shower over bath worked well so complaints! The room has a safe and you can even shine your shoes with an electric buffer. Wireless internet in the room worked beautifully! The hotel feels a little old and outdated because of its simplicity, decor and colour but that should not stop you from staying here. The layout is a little strange and we came across guests who were lost a few times (just like we were!) but once you find your way around, it's no problem whatsoever. There is an outdoor pool and spacious lobby with seats. If I return to San Francisco I wouldn't look further and would return to The Handlery with no hesitation. I have attached photos so you can see for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Central”
Reviews.Author: KateandRemy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel, most dissapointing about this stay was the breakfast , poor choice and shocking service, i have never had to wait to be seated for 15 minutes while the back of the room had plenty of room, the guys worked their butts off cleaning where as the serving staff were very slow. The location of this hotel is fantastic, close to all shops and bus tour pick ups. The staff in hotel were great and helpfull. negative was breakfast restaurant. However if you go do stay there, have a look at restaurant/ Pub bar 2 doors up named "Leftys" i think after famous baseballer great food and great atmosphere. they love the San Francisco Giants in there. Some other great restaurants around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “just all right”
Reviews.Author: sotman
Reviews.Content: stayed here for four nights in an historic room with my wife and twenty year old daughter.while the staff were nice and hotel facilities were also nice we just could not get passed the fact that the rooms were too small, and the bathroom far too small and not practical at all. we also could here all the street nosie and were unable to get any quality sleep,suggest they sound proof these rooms better..On a good note the hotel is in a good position to resturants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: PortlandRob
Reviews.Content: Some people recommended this hotel and we're glad they did. They had excellent service, the staff was very friendly, and it was very comfortable. It was very close to Union Square, which put us in the middle of where we wanted to be.

Reviews.Title: “great location! would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: blinkoshuman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Room was clean and very comfortable. It is a small room, but had everything we needed. Shower was excellent. Our room faced a wall, which wasn't much of a view, but we didn't get any street noise at all. Hallways are very quiet for such a busy hotel. Nice exercise room and heated pool with courtyard. Lobby is comfortable. We needed help with the thermostat and a maintenance person came within 5 min. of our call. We didn't use the concierge, but he was available all day and seemed to be very helpful to others. The restaurant is nice, but pricey. Location is terrific. Very convenient to public transportation and cable car. Lots of breakfast choices nearby. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: ggomes04
Reviews.Content: It was our visit to San Francisco, and the Handlery Hotel was the perfect place to stay. Yes, the room was very small (European style), but it had everything we needed. The hotel is in the middle of Union Sq with shops and public transportation, great for every tourist. The hotel was great, heated pool, private sauna (with appointment), friendly people. Union Sq is good place to stay for the 1st time visitor but I would not stay there a 2nd time. Too many tourists, lines for everything, my husband was in the starbucks when a lady's purse was snatched.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kmdub
Reviews.Content: For first time visitors to San Francisco, the location of the Handlery Union Square could not be better. Public transport is easy and close and some places of interest and shopping areas within easy walking distance. Our room faced O'Farrell Street and, because it is a city, there was some noise, but nothing which greatly disturbed. It was spacious and clean. We had vouchers for breakfast in the Daily Grill and were well set up for the day following our meals there.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat Hermie for taking good care of a traveler!!”
Reviews.Author: patandlinda_11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I use The Handlery as home base when we visit S.F. to shop, see a show, and dine. It has recently been upgraded and the bedding and decor is very nice. They have a pool which is very popular and an excellent location, a few steps from Union Square. We feel very comfortable and safe at The Handlery and would recommend it to anyone looking for the same kind of experience. Because we are at the hotel at least several times a year, we have been very familiar with the people providing services and Hermie is a person I'd like to commend. He always recognizes me and greets me warmly. He is cheerful, helpful, and dependable. What a great employee the hotel has!

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice welcome, always a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel020
Reviews.Content: Each July, SemiconWest comes to San Francisco. My husband attends this show and for the past dozen years has booked his room at the Handlery. I always come along just to hang out, shop and sightsee. The location is perfect, especially if you want to shop. You can jump on the cable cars, one half block away and be whisked away to other parts of the City. .....As for the hotel, we like to stay in the newer section, on the side facing O'Farrell street. This visit we had a King Club Room located on the the 7th floor. The room has recently been renovated and was quite cozy. I noticed new double paned sliding doors, which open onto a small furnished balcony, that really shut out the city noise. As usual the room was clean and provided all basic amenities: hair dryer, toiletries, robes, iron and board, coffee maker, coffee and water. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The shower offered ample water pressure, and the bathroom provided me with adequate lighting for applying my make-up. The personal were friendly and very helpful, willing to go that extra mile. Next time we stay overnight in the City, you can bet it will be at the Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering”
Reviews.Author: robsaint
Reviews.Content: Front Desk where friendly and helpful. They realised upon check in that we had a noisy room and they changed it the next night when one became available. We had 4 staying in the room and room was a little larger than an average sized room do we didn't feel so cramped. Room was clean and bathroom good. Had plenty of power points to recharge ipods, cameras etc. Great location near Union square and the shops. Also really close to the cabel car and westfield shopping centre. Hop on Hop off tour stop was at union square which was really handy. Didn't use the Gym, pool(looked ok) or restaurant which was linked to the hotel. Would most likely stay there again. San Francisco is a great place to visit wish we stayed longer, 3 nights is not enough. Hope to go back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: sac93212
Reviews.Content: The Handlery Union Square Hotel is in a great location, clean with nice facilities and has some of the best front desk service I have ever received. I would recommend this hotel a thousand times over. DO NOT BOOK THROUGH PRICELINE.COM. Although the issues that arose were the fault of booking through priceline.com. The Handlery Hotel front desk staff handled the issues swiftly and did whatever they could to make me happy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ljungskog
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a Premier Section, 2 queen beds room, facing Farrel street. The rooms are large, clean and nice. But the best selling point for this hotel, is its location. Most of the best shopping San Francisco has to offer, is near by. The historic cable cars runs 200 meters from the hotel, and the antique tramlines (F-Market line) departs from Market Street, a 5 minute walk from the hotel. If Your arriving in San Francisco Airport, the BART train will take You to Powell street, which is a 7 minute walk from the hotel. Why all that talk about public transportation ? First of all because the Handlery is very convenient situated for using public transportation and San Francisco is very compact and ideal for getting around by busses, trams or cablecars. Secondly because The Handlery Hotels charges 38$(+tax+tips) pr. day for parking. If you only need the parking from late afternoon until the next morning (5:30PM - 09:00AM), the Hertz Garage just around the corner charges 20$ for selfparking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juljim5961
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Premier poolside room. The room was clean and luxurious with many special touches. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located very close to Union Square where we grabbed our bus tours. Make sure you have breakfast at O'Dooley's which is next door.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job!”
Reviews.Author: Lucie02
Reviews.Content: Agree with the previous comments. Great location. Staff very friendly. Rooms quite spacious. Breakfast was good. Safe provided, tea/coffee, fridge. Comfortable bed. Stayed on 3rd floor at back of hotel - quiet. Only comment I would have is that the sound proofing of this room was poor - conversations of those next door could be heard. Fortunately everything quietened down to allow a good nights sleep. Room service good. Easy to access Fisherman's Wharf for boat trips, alcatraz etc - just a couple of dollars on the streetcar, although would definitely recommend getting a pass if you are staying for a few days - includes travel on the various types of transport throughout the city and as each ride on the old trolley cars is $5 this can be a good saving. Tip for riding trolley car - dont stand in the big queues at the end of the line, but try and hop on at one of the many trolley car stops at the stop lights along the route. Recommend Cheescake Factory in Maceys for great meal (and fantastic cheesecake!) and views of union square from roof terrace - but pre-book if eating in evening as popular! Take a walk through chinatown and then North Beach to see 'real' san fran - and great cafes and eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Geoff & Barbara
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a couple of other hotels in San Francisco, we've not found one to beat the Handlery for location, price and comfort. This was our second visit here. We found the porter on duty when we arrived very helpful : he came halfway down the street to where we'd managed to park, took our bags into store until we'd delivered the hire-car and then brought them to our room once we'd booked in. We'd requested a room with a pool view and were given one on the ground floor, with large patio doors leading out onto the poolside tiles, with sun chairs and loungers - a nice (mostly quiet) place to sit in the sunshine. The room was a good size with king bed, settee and armchair, adequate hanging, drawer and desk-top space, good decor, coffeemaker and two small complimentary bottles of water. The bathroom was compact, but with plenty of room for toilet bags. We didn't have breakfast here; preferring to turn right out of the hotel and go a couple of doors down Geary Street to Lefty O'Douls - very popular, but we always got a seat immediately for a good selection of well-cooked, excellent value food. The Daily Grill Bar in the hotel had a nice atmosphere for a cool drink at the end of a day's sight-seeing - and seemed just as happy to serve soft drinks as more expensive alcolholic ones. We enjoyed our stay here and intend to come back next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed and stay and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Lvim
Reviews.Content: We found our room to be very adequate but the view from the eighth floor not so good , but the staff and amenities were excellent, it was so handy to a lot of local attractions and restaurants, we would recommend it to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel sf could offer!!”
Reviews.Author: cincity916
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at handlery for sf 2011 pride weekend. We were given a small 2 bed room but the room was quite, the maids gave us fresh liens and towels when we asked and even the room service was amazing! We did have a noise complaint, we said our sorries to our neighbors who understood that my girl and I had just got engaged. The check in and out process was so easy and all the employees were extremly gay friendly. Thanks again for making june 24-26,2011 the best weekend of our lives. Special shot outs to the bellman, jose, for bringing out 200000 suitcases to our room and understanding that we had no clue ho to tip, he got a 20 though!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: tomfromal
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed five nights and although our room with two beds was a little small, the Handlery is a great place to stay. The prior six reviews pretty much say it all. Our trip would not have been any better if we had stayed at some hotel with a grand old lobby at a much higher price. We highly recommend this hotel for its convenience, cleanliness, value, and service. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. And, we requested a quiet room on an upper floor and that is just what we got. No street noise at all. But, I do have to wonder about why the refrigerator is in a cabinet where the cabinet door and refrigerator door do not open the same way. Otherwise, just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: crpuravida
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a wonderful stay. Unfortunately, I was there for only 2 nights, wished I could have stayed longer!!! The location of the hotel is wonderful, just steps away from Union Square and quite close to different interesting areas. Being on a business trip the only thing that did not work for me was having to pay for the WI FI which most of the hotels these days include as part of their services, but other than that, it is definitely a hotel I would come back to...

Reviews.Title: “So convenient and reasonably priced!”
Reviews.Author: maw8
Reviews.Content: A few couples all stayed here this weekend for a get-together. We LOVED the location and the price of this hotel. You just can't beat how close it is to Union Square (it's there!) for the price. We stayed in a suite this time, #434. It was nicely appointed yet modest. Nice flat panel TV and bedding was terrific. Since we were in a room that was on a light well our room was very quiet. My friend stayed in #501 which faced the street and was woken up by the street noise. Even though we had no view, it was worth the extra sleep especially since we weren't in our room long at all. I do wish they had blackout curtains on the windows. Our room wasn't too bad but another in our party stayed in #634 and they got really early morning light since they were higher up. Bummer. Seems like it would be easy to fix. The front desk clerks were terrific. The concierge was a bit stuffy but helpful anyway. We've stayed at this hotel 4-5 years ago with our children when they were small. This is one of the only hotels around Union Square with a pool. It's still there and still lovely and fits the bill if you have kids and need a break from tourist stuff. It's not a pool to really sit out and sunbathe and has no jacuzzi. Although this isn't a 5-Star property we'll still come back here again and again due to the price, the location and the beds being very comfortable. If you look at their specials we've sometimes had parking and breakfast included. We didn't need it this time but next time we go I'd make sure to look to see if they pay for themselves. Parking is about $35-$38/night which is fairly standard hotel parking in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra convenient and accomodating hotel”
Reviews.Author: swankphotostacy
Reviews.Content: It was a fantastic central San Fran location. Trolley rides were just across the street. You could catch the BART (SF train system) to and from SFO by walking a mere 5 minutes/2 blocks. Very convenient. $10 taxi ride down to Fisherman's Wharf where you can pick up an Alcatraz Ferry tour. The rooms were really nice and comfortable. Nice bedding and view. 2Q bed rooms were large and it was nice to have a vanity/dressing area right outside the bathroom. We didn't get to eat at this hotel for breakfast or any other meal. You don't need a car in SF. Transportation is everywhere. Definitely would recommend The Handlery!

Reviews.Title: “So Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Coddydc
Reviews.Content: We were lucky that we found the Handerly on our first trip to San Francisco. We didn't know the good from the bad, and our budget didn't allow for a five star hotel. We saw the reviews, and the hotel owner's videos and thought it would be a good match. We were extremely happy with our choice. After a room move to a higher floor, we settled into a spacious and modern room facing Geary. They are dog friendly which is a bonus for us. All and all the staff is great. A number of individuals went out of their way to assist (Matt the Front Desk Manager, the sixth floor housekeeper, and the overnight bellman at check out). Others were delightful in their interactions (Marty at the desk and the new female intern at the desk in particular) and a whole litany of other staff who really seemed to enjoy their jobs or at least interacting with guests. We did encounter some flat service here and there which became so obvious considering the rest of the staff. At check-in, we asked for the highest floor possible due to street noise (see below) and was told by the agent (name withheld) we were getting the highest floor available on two. Our bags had not even arrived and we knew we wouldn't be happy and called the desk to see about options. A different agent immediately offered a higher floor. Our first agent was efficient but cold as he told us no other rooms were available. This was also the same desk agent who bluntly told us we were wrong when we asserted our understanding that parking was included in our package rate. We asked that he double check, which he did, and low and behold, we knew what we purchased. Not enough to ruin our stay, but certainly stood out against a lot of other great people. Not rude, just flat, blunt and lacking warmth. Like a lot of higher end hotels they charge for internet access. Someday, I hope this tier of hotels will take a lesson from their lower tier brethren and nix the charge. After paying a premium for the room, it's seems like nickel and diming, especially when a Motel 6, or most any other place, includes it as an amenity. The one and only downside, was not their problem...there was a protest of a hotel across the street. Being awakened at 7 am on a Saturday during your vacation by a guy screaming into a bull horn "no contract, no sleep" is not fun. We heard this was due to an ongoing labor dispute. They made a lot of noise for four people. It's too bad the Handerly guests have to suffer. Suggest upgrading the windows on the next renovation to reduce the noise. Although, sans the protest, the street noise is tolerable if you've lived in a city if any size. The location is perfect if you are there to be a tourist, which we were. Close to everything. The atrium pool, the quaint but modern layout of the property and the rooms makes this a great place go stay. It's an upscale hotel with people who are real and care enough to try to make your stay enjoyable. Well done Mr. Handerly.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Has It All!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lottie010
Reviews.Content: Three "senior" teachers spent a delightful 5 days in San Francisco -- enjoying all of the tourist highlights!! From Alcatraz, cruises, double-decker tours, etc. -- we were busy from early to late!! The Handlery was the perfect spot for restful nights with CLEAN, comfy beds, refrigerator, beautiful decor and a wonderful 8th floor view of the city!! We enjoyed having a separate vanity outside the bathroom which was nice. The elevator was right outside our room but we were never bothered by any noise. We did not look at the older parts of the hotel so I am not commenting on those rooms. We had what they called a premier room with two queens and lots of room. All of this would not equal, though, the wonderful staff at this hotel that made us not only feel welcome -- but made us feel like they were there to make sure we were having a positive experience. We checked in on Thursday with a quick hassle-free registration. We were even allowed to look at two separate empty rooms to see which one we preferred! We had requested a balcony but none was available so "Manny" at the desk wanted us to have the next best!!! He was great -- happy and personable -- (as were all the others!!) The pool area is just lovely (although it was far too cold to enjoy!!!) The location of the hotel could not have been more convenient -- two blocks from Union Square (STORES!), cable cars, beautiful historic architecture, BART, and a quick trip to the wharf aboard Muni. I had read dozens and dozens and dozens of Trip Advisor reviews to help select a hotel. Most of the Handlery's reviews were very positive -- I now see why!! We join with all of the other pleased travelers!! Arkansas is a long trip, but if we ever get back -- the Handlery will be our choice! A+ (from these teachers!)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: travelBme
Reviews.Content: Solo trip for 2 1/2 days and the location of this hotel was superb for running around. Union Square 1 block, a few blocks from Bart station and Market Street and right by Powell for shops, restaurants and trolley car. rooms were good size, clean and comfortable. I had a room in historic section with king bed and very comfy bed and pillows (I have bad neck and had great sleep). Didn't eat in hotel but great thai place on Powell just a quick walk. I forgot something in my room and went back while maid was there, she had me run my key in the door to ensure it was my room and that was a good feeling. front desk staff were very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for families to stay”
Reviews.Author: Oscar12345
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to get a family suite in the city, however, the Handlery has several unique rooms that make your trip easier if you are traveling with kids. We usually stay in the ":executive suite" which is great for a family. It is an open suite with a king sized bed for the parents in a large room with a hide-a-bed in an adjoining room. There are two tv's and a bay window that overlooks Geary. This time my kids took friends, We tried the ":family suite" which had two twin beds in a separate room with a TV, fridge , hide-a-bed, and a desk, In between the two rooms was a large walk in closet. Both rooms led into a bathroom. The other room in the suite had a double bed and a sink that was enclosed in a closet, there was also an additional closet and tv in the room. This room is great for parents. There wasn't a view to this type of room but the kids loved having their own space. They loved the heated pool too. I love this hotel and have stayed there over 20 times. It is so convenient and it is also safe. The staff has been there forever and will go out of their way to help you. It is affordable but it is also quaint. This is not a luxury hotel, but it has character and you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “top location but take your laptop!!”
Reviews.Author: fats_and_als
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The staff were helpful and even upgraded us when we told them we were celebrating our anniversary. The room we were given was comfortable with two windows, they werent overlooking San francisco but nevertheless it was a really clean and comfortable room. The bathroom was dated however adequate. The most positive things to note was the housekeeping staff and super fast service. The most negative part of our stay was the totally overpriced internet facility the hotel offered. I would certainly recommend this hotel as it was in a really smart and central location for considerably less money than The Westin St Francis which is across the Street (albeit the Westin is a stunning building and survived the great earthquake).

Reviews.Title: “Nice service except for restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Belindabiddick
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of friends. We were in different parts of the hotel to begin with but the rooms were changed with no problem. The newer part of the hotel is nicer as far as the rooms go. If you want to nap during the day, request a room away from the pool! I loved my room overlooking the pool with a balcony and it would be a great place if a person wanted to smoke a cigarette out on the balcony. On to the restaurant....we had a decent breakfast (only meal we ate in the hotel rest.). The waiter (can't remember his name) was rude and the service wasn't very good. We were in a hurry to get on our way to our day's events but it took FOREVER (probably 15 minutes after asking another waiter to find our waiter) to get our check. The waiter seemed put out with us....seven women. Gratuity was added 18% (which I don't like)...I always think they feel like they don't have to provide good service if their tip is automatically added. If not for the restaurant service on our last day, I would have rated higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but tiny bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: briansnana
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here 1 night, and maybe that's why they put us in what was possibly the worst room in the hotel. It was on the 4th floor at the end of the hall, with a winding staircase beside it. It looked like maybe an after thought, or where a much larger suite had been divided. We had a great view of a brick wall from the window, but the tiny bathroom is my biggest complaint. It was so small in the sink area, that when you went to brush your teeth, your elbows hit the side of the wall on the left, and the side of the shower on the right (I'm not kidding). I rated the hotel average for this reason, because there were many other good things about it. Although the room was small, it had beautiful bedding, super confortable bed, flat screen TV, and granite counter top in the bathroom. The entire hotel was spotless, including the room. I especially liked the pool/Courtyard area- beautifully decorated with flowers. There were rooms around the pool, with patios and balconies, but I guess we didn't pay enough for one of those. :-( , and as they say, location, location, location--was great. Right across the street from Union Square, and the Irish restaurant next door, Lefty O'douls, had great food with great prices. I'd recommend this hotel for a 1 or 2 night stay, but not any longer....unless you pay enough to get a larger room, with a full size bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Stop the search honey, The Handlery Hotel is it!”
Reviews.Author: RobertTheRealtor
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to the city (SF) we had the pleasure of discovering The Handlery Hotel at Union Square. It is centrally located, clean, updated & the service is excellent. While our suite did not have a view, it was ultra quiet and provided a restful place for us in between our city ventures. We highly recommend The Handlery Hotel, located near the cable cares, Union Square and one of our favorite breakfast spots, Sears Fine Foods.

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit”
Reviews.Author: SouthShoresLady
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Handerly many times because it is one of the best bargins in the City. Their prices are very compeitive. It is a very nice small to medium size hotel located accoss the Street from the Saint Francis right at Union Square. They have their own parking garage (where many of the older hotels in the Union Square Area do not have on site parking-then it take forever to get your car) . Close to the Bart and Muni station for public transit. Rooms are well maintained and nicely decorated. Great for families. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Small pool in an inclosed patio and small workout room with weights and treadmills. Next door to the Daily Grill who provides room service.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we'll stay when we're in SF”
Reviews.Author: keharty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Handlery many times in the past. As we live only an hour north it's our little getaway from home. This time we had family with us who flew in for my daughter's wedding and as they had never been to SF they wanted to stay one night in the city. We immediately told them we had the THE place to stay. About a month before their visit they called and made their reservation for a Club level room with a street view and two queen beds (they had teenagers with them). I immediately booked a room for my husband and I and requested Club level with a street view and a king bed and asked to be on the same floor as our relatives. The reservation person offered me ajoining rooms which I happily accepted. When we went to check into the hotel I was told that we could only get ajoining rooms with a pool view and that my husband and I would have two queen beds. When I questioned why our original request couldn't be honored I was told that blocks of rooms couldn't be reserved. Huh? Part of the fun in staying in SF, especially for people from out of town, is watching the people on the streets so that wouldn't work for us. We were then offered rooms on the same floor but not ajoining which we decided to accept but then found out that our room had no balcony. I wasn't aware that any of the street view rooms came without balconies and we wanted to be able to open the sliding door and enjoy the unusual warm weather that night so we requested to be moved. We finally ended up on seperate floors from our out of town relatives which was slightly inconvenient but acceptable. Other than the mix up with the rooms, everything was wonderful as usual. Large, modern and clean rooms, helpful staff and great location. We ate at the Daily Grill for the first time and my meal was excellent. We were also offered vouchers for free wireless internet which our relatives used. We wouldn't stay anyplace else in SF and will continue to recommend the Handlery to all our friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and we'd stay here again. .”
Reviews.Author: Vicki_TD
Reviews.Content: All in all a very nice hotel in a perfect area for walking the city sites and shops. We had reservations weeks in advance and our flight was 3 hours late from United (hate that airline!!). We arrived at midnight and the manager checked us in. .we found our room with no sheets, linen on the floor and the window open. Not happy but par for the day. . we went to the desk and the lady gave us a great room with a balcony that was perfect for our 6-day stay. So. . if something isn't right they make it right. Thats what counts. All else was very nice for the week as well. . nicely kept and the cozy blankets are even made in the USA! (Texttillery in Bloomington ID) Five stars for that aspect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RoelR
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the hotel, and were helped by a very friendly intern, Kathleen. She gave us room 657. A fairly large room, with a cosy bathroom. Both of them clean. Everything you need is there. The only thing we didn't have was a view, room was located on the inside of the building. This room was quiet during the night, no street or other guest noises. The hotel has a retro feeling, with thick carpets and old fashioned wallpaper. The pool is located in the middle of the hotel, and has sun during the afternoon. Ideal for a quick swim to freshen up. The hotel's location is perfect, next to Union Square, two blocks away from the Cablecar turnpoint, lots of restaurants and shops. Hop-On - Hop-Off buses stop nearly in front. Overall we had a nice stay, and would recommend this hotel to everyone. Only drawback is no free wireless internet, but there are Starbucks and McDonalds which do have it closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean, comfortable, meals well priced & tasty”
Reviews.Author: KARAKAKIWI
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on this hotel we requested an inside room because of potential noise. That worked well for us, the room was quiet. The view was not particularly good - all back of building stuff outside but we felt better to be quiet. Good service from stall too

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dee40222
Reviews.Content: I just booked this hotel for one night because we couldn't get into the Hyatt the first night of our trip. Wish I hadn't prepaid the Hyatt. My daughter and I loved the Handlery! Foremost, we were offered our choice of a view or an extra quiet (i.e. airshaft) room. I chose the latter and it was perfect for us. A calm, quiet oasis in the midst of lively San Francisco. Easy walking to great eats, streetcar, trolley, and many sights. Bed-excellent, sheets & towels-luxurious, bathroom-absolutely spotless, front desk staff- could not have been nicer. I also liked the quick in and out of the hotel--small lobby right to elevator. I could get from my room to outside in a minute or two. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...”
Reviews.Author: XXTravel
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by a friend. It is centrally located and cheap. But not worth USD 170. Very disappointed and would never stay here again. Specifically asked for a quiet room- but got a very noisy room on the second floor. Paper thin walls and terrible service. When asking for a late check-out due to a delayed flight I was simply told no because they were fully booked. I travel a lot and have never experienced this ever before. Breakfast was horrible and way below average US standard- voucher only gives you either juice OR tea...weird.. No new water bottles in hotel room on day two. Only positive thing was speedy and free wireless Internet access. If you are looking for a relaxing stay- simply avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Clean,Value!”
Reviews.Author: Joybells07
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on the recommendation of a friend. We were not disappointed. We had an early arrival, but were checked in straight away. We had a king room on the 6th floor overlooking the street, but with the double glazing we did not hear a thing. The rooms are clean - no bedbugs and very comfortable! Check out was easy, the account was delivered the night before so we could check it. Morning of departure we called the Bell Desk, they collected our bags, gave them our room keys and the taxi was waiting downstairs. There are 3 different ways in and out of the hotel, which was handy not to have to go through the Lobby all the time. The location was very excellent for restaurants and shopping. The cable cars are so cheap and easy to use that we had no problem paying the fares and getting around the city. So if you like to be amongst the bustle of a city we would recommend this hotel as a great base in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations”
Reviews.Author: ISORRO
Reviews.Content: It was my 1st time in San Francisco, California, We stayed on the Handlery for 4days - 3nights it was a quick check-in and check-out. The Doormen were very helpful! This hotel was pretty clean and beds where super soft and comfortable which I was surprise about this. We had a double bed, a flat screen tv, a little fridge, a desk and descent size bathroom with all the basic amenities and last but not least this place had a nice decor very contemporary but a bit dark. Not sure if it was because it rain all 3 days.... Yikes! Our room were always kept clean and beds were always made by housekeeping. Nice Job :) We never visited the pool since it was cold and gloomy out. In fact ,we never spent enough time in the hotel we went to adventure of in San Francisco , we only slept at night time. So far I can say that this location is a great spot to stay. We almost walked to all the famous landmarks in San Francisco. Public transportation is right in front of hotel (regular buses) Trolly is on the corner. All major department stores where right there on our location. Places we visited: Civic Center (SOMA) Downtown Area Fisherman's Wharf - Pier 33 through 47 (we had a awesome Clam Chowder on the Pier) The Embarcadero Tenderloin (Scary for 3 out of town girls) Yikes! Chinatown (2x) Nob Hill Russian Hill Financial District Golden Gate Bridge (what a marvelous walk) We've only passed by the Gold Gate Park since it was raining! Yerba Buena Gardens Coit Tower Passed by the Moscone Convention Center Buena Vista Park ....Oh and ....The food at San Fan was .... SPECTACULAR we went to a couple of places that were recommended and we discovered some hidden gems as well. Thanks so much for reading this quick tip advisor! ISORRO

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value, Clean, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ivyc
Reviews.Content: SF hotels are really expensive and I got a double for les than 150 with tax/fees. I requested a quit room and that is what i got. The lobby is pleasant and the restruant breakfast was very good. As i expected the room was very small and i was slighty dissappointed with the bed and pillows but for the money its a great value for a short stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: POLLYANNA57
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at the Handlery and chose it because of TA critiques. Stayed in SFO 10 years ago and nearly chose previous hotel. The Handlery was a much better hotel in the same area. All the hotel's staff are the friendliest, obliging people we have encountered anywhere after many years of travel. After the unavoidable and horrible long flights over from Australia, after which we always feel like we have crawled out of a dumpster, and probably look like we have too unfortunately, at a very early morning check-in, to our great joy and relief we were assigned a room immediately. Bliss. I observed all the Reception staff trying to assign all guests at check-in a room immediately. This is a very commendable practice and shows a hotel with not only well trained staff but a very tight and regimented house-keeping system. How intelligent. And rare! Well done folks. We had an 8th floor room on right side building facing the pool and it had a room like balcony, perfect. The rooms are very spacious and fitouts quite luxurious. The hotel is deceptively large, in a spread out way causing the occasional oddity with lift access up one level to one wing. The staff are abundant and more than obliging helping guests with luggage at all times. However the hotel does cater to guests requiring Handicapped facilities and special access or rooms. Location is perfect. Right in the Retail Centre and Union Square area and an easy walk up or down to the BART station at a cost of only $US 8.10 per person to/from airport. Effortless. Recommend buying the 2 day tickets for the Hop on Hop off Buses and definitely as many rides on the thrilling cable car/trams across as many routes as possible. San Francisco is a vibrant city and great for walking around. Our only negative experience. Ten years ago there was evidence of a drug problem in SFO. This time from the minute we arrived in the CBD we were constantly approached by homeless/beggars. I calculate we (very carefully) handed out what amounted to $US 50.00 in small change across the course of the 3 days. Great care needs to be taken in any public place, Hot Dog stands, the BART ticket machines, similar. They pounce. Usually it is just a request for the change but can be overwhelming. We saw a very young man going thru a rubbish bin at Union Square and carefully sorting the contents and happily going off with what food he deemed still edible by himself.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother, there are better hotels”
Reviews.Author: minxymoo66
Reviews.Content: Staff weren't that friendly - weird, we thought this was the country where customer service was exceptional, which it has been for our entire stay in the US. This was our last stop on a 3 city trip. The bar closed at 10 and the barman that served us was positively surly. We had breakfast vouchers which only allowed you one drink (either tea, OR coffee, OR orange juice). First morning we realised the water they bring you for the tea is enough for 3 cups, so I brought a teabag from the room (same as the ones on the restaurant table) and just asked for a cup, thinking we could share the OJ and the tea. The waiter said we were only allowed one choice and wouldn't bring me a cup until I said I had brought my own teabag, and then with a huffy attitude??? Rooms small even though we had booked a superior room and and the bathroom is REALLY tiny and the loo roll holder fell to bits on the first use! Waiters were ok, but not up to the standard we had come to expect in america. Road noise wasn't as loud as the air con unit which we couldn't turn off or even change the settings! Definitely in need of an upgrade! Cleaning staff were good and were respectful of your schedule. Wifi cost us (per computer) $9.95 for 24 hours (Hotel Frank across the road had free wifi, only needed a password from reception). It is pretty far from everywhere except Union Square, but the public transport is pretty good in San Francisco, and if you have the stamina for the hills, you can walk from the waterfront up Mason, but it will take about an hour plus. All in all, an average hotel which I will not be hurrying back to.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok if you want to stay near Union Square for cheap.”
Reviews.Author: LufTravel
Reviews.Content: I was quite disapointed in my stay here. Rooms were small, damp, obviously re-done but poorly. The bathroom was tiiiiiny, old toilet and shower. The bed was comfy, I will say that. Entrance to the rooms are outside like an old sketchy motel. It seemed that everyone staying at this hotel was smoking outside their doors which is a huge turn off for me. Cigarettes butts and ashtrays everywhere I would only stay here again as its close to Union Square for shopping if you can get a cheap rate. Be sure to check out Dottie's Cafe 4 minutes from the hotel. That placed made by stay at the Handlery tolerable!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to do the Tourist thing!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewN259
Reviews.Content: We just had a fantastic 3 week trip around Los Angeles, San Francisco and Las Vegas and am sorry to report that this was the lowlight of the trip. A few things that we found unsatisfactory was the street noise in the rooms. We asked to moved after the second night as we just was not getting any sleep, and to their credit they did move us, but the second room was not a great deal better. The owner of the hotel was good enough to come out and meet us as we were know to him through a business contact, but unfortunately the rest of the staff were very stand offish. The bell captain made money out of calling particular cab drivers, even though it meant we waited 20 minutes for his cabbie friend to arrive and the two different gentlement on the tour desk found it very hard to crack a smile or put any effort into our requests for help. The rooms are very small and it looks like they have been made small over the years to make room for bathrooms, as I believe at one stage, the guests used to share bathrooms on each floor. Overall I guess this was ok for a 3.5 star hotel, but it's distance from all things that are touristy in SF is a problem. Almost every activity we did, or tour we took left or was in Fishermans Wharf with the exception of Union Square. My recommendation would be to stay at Fishhermans Wharf if you are there oon holidays, and make one trip into Union Square and save yourself a lot of travelling time and the cost of getting to Fishermans Wharf and back everyday! Feel free to drop me a line if you would like any further info

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - 2nd visit in 2 years.....”
Reviews.Author: Yonkers_au
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It's my 2nd visit in 2 years and will be my preferred hotel in San Francisco. I arrived a day late due to my international flight being cancelled. When I checked in, my booking was still available and the check-in staff were more than helpful. I was in the historic wing in a small room which was more than suitable and comfortable enough for a solo traveler. A few of the staff remembered me from my stay last year and it felt like a big family was running the hotel. The hotel is a two minute walk to Union Square and is central to all shopping areas. This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in in a long time and I'll be definitely staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Globaltrading
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at the hotel but they let us checked in. The room was clean and the bed was so comfy but the room was a bit small but it's normal in SF. There was leakage in the zinc in our room and they can't fix it at that time. They changed our room the next day. All the staff were kind and helpful, specially one night manager (I forgot his name) that was always kind enough to greet us whenever we met. The location was very near to Union Square. We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. Tips: across the hotel there is a japanese ramen restaurant. Try it. It's worth the queue.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!! Great Service as well!!”
Reviews.Author: Renee M
Reviews.Content: This is the ultimate location if you are going to san fran.. The cable car line runs right past and runs to the famous Pier 39.. Union Square is literally a 1 minute walk and the shopping is AMAZING!! The staff were extremely helpful and upgraded our room on arrival. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Norcalmommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a getaway weekend. The valet parking is behind the hotel and they do not offer an elevator. You have to walk up and down the stairs to get to the front desk. The staff are rude and do not care about customer satisfaction. We paid over $200 a night and the room was smaller than my closet. It was old, smelly and our room looked out onto the main street which was very noisy. In the morning, there were picketers outside across the street, which woke us at 6:50am. When we called the front desk, they apologized but did nothing. When we checked out, we were not asked how our stay was or thanked for our business. I wouldn't stay here again if it was free. Do not stay here...buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Smelled like old people”
Reviews.Author: Shawn215
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what you want for a short stay in the Union Square area. The building itself was very disjointed, so going from the parking garage to your room was a process. The central location made me forget about the room smell, and the bathroom was pretty big. The price was very reasonable, especially if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean/Great location”
Reviews.Author: NMIC
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights celebrating 30th anniversary. Champagne and goodies waiting in room for us. Nice little spotlessly clean king room overlooking streets of S F. Yes, we had some street noise..no biggie, it's S F! Our last morning there when we were going to sleep in..The Frank Hotel directly across the street from our room, employees began the loudest protest that I have ever heard at 7am sharp! No sleeping in for anyone! They ruined our last day! It would have been nice if the front desk personnel would have apologized or at least mentioned it, after all I just spent almost $700 with them.. Oh well! The concierge was very helpful and a true sweetheart. Front desk staff just average, typical get you in and get you out. Overall great location, clean, comfy rooms for average of $200 a night. Seems outrageous for this Texan but reasonable for the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dunedintraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely family run hotel for 4 nights in May 2011. It is a very central location for exploring San Francisco. Check in was straight forward, and the room was reasonably small but really nicely decorated, and clean. We left a comment on the card in our room re the internet charge and got a reply sent to us in New Zealand from the President and General Manager. Very impressive. We would definately reccommend the Handlery Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for location and spacious, attractive accomodations”
Reviews.Author: redborn51
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent value with a reduced overnight parking rate. The room had great amenities and was very large and comfortable. Nice new decor with comfy bedding and renovated bathroom with traditional fixtures such as marble and a dressing table area. Robes - yay!! The view from my room was a small courtyard and nice to have a pool although I did not use it. The only weird thing was trying to find the room....there seem to be two elevators accessing the rooms leading to two different sections of the hotel that were not connected. But once I got the hang of it, it was no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “All about Union Sq”
Reviews.Author: mWrite
Reviews.Content: The entrance to hotel was nice, bell boy greeting and wiling to grab luggage (thanks, as a European I handle them myself) entered reception area. Everything went smoothly. Later I noticed that elevators were slow, so I ended up running up to 5th floor. It keeps you fit. Room was on so called Historic site and was very good. Of course it is also very different from 2 year old hotel room at Hiltons were I stayed previous night. Historic room has its own style, even though TV set is new flat screen and other materials too. For San Francisco, I wanted more suitable feeling, touching city's history, not faceless standardized room. Noise from street can be heard clearly, but this was 5th floor historic room. I totally share opinions that bathrooms are small, I have had wardrobes bigger than this bathroom in my room or Lufthansa A380 First Class bathroom was bigger w/o shower (thanks LH for upgrade). I would like to though point out, bathroom was suitable, clean, with amenities and perfect for its functions, shaving, showering etc. At the end we are talking about bathroom, not a ballroom. Staff was good in normal interactions (check-in/out), except one bell boy, but I think I contribute that more to language or Europe vs America. Concierge gave good service and helped with Shuttle to airport. (ended up lot of shopping) What I like in this hotel also as European, it is reachable with Bart (not Simpson) from SFO Intl. airport to Powell St (30min ride) and even with luggage another 7 min walk from station to hotel. USD8.10. I always prefer tracks vs taxi(cab) as it can get expensive if you get stuck in traffic jam. Quite often taxi drivers tend to give you bit sight seeing. Hotel has an Excellent location, just few meters from Union Square. And by the way, San Francisco is bloody freezing city. If you think that you packed enough clothes, pack additional sweater.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: sdsuindian
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to SF on business. I'm not sure how people do there rating, but compared to other hotels I have been to this is at best a 3 star. Definitely not the most modern hotel. I liked that there was a fridge in the room and the staff was great. There is a lot of shopping nearI suggest using the stairs, the elevator is old and slow. I had one meal at the restaurant which was expensive and not that good. I ordered a hamburger with french fries. The fries were WAY too salty and the bun was hard. The bathroom had a shower and the sink was outside of the bathroom in the front hall in a way too small area (ok for me, but if I were there with my GF not even close to enough room). Ive stayed in worse and Ive stayed in nicer in SF, but this was a good deal for what i payed.

Reviews.Title: “smelliest room i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: lucas2000_4
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location but the room we had was the worst I've ever experienced. The service at check in was very good but no bell service was offered. The hotel is very old and has had a refurb but still cannot get rid of the very strong musty overpowering smell in the hallways and especially in our room. We were lucky we got a room with a window as many don't have one. The room was small and the aircon was noisy and useless. We had to have our old sash window fully open the whole time - even at night. The view from the window was of the old dirty rooftops of the neighbouring buildings. During the day the place was frequented with cooing pidgeons and at night the noise of the street performers and nearby bars carried on till till about midnight. My wife was feeling sick from the unholy musty smell. Rooms like this should not be so expensive even if the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Torunto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights for a conference. The location is fantastic, 1/2 block from Union Square and 5 blocks from Convention Center. My room was lovely and spacious for San Francisco. The fan made noise and I called the front desk to have it fixed while I was out. When I returned there was a note on the bed saying they could not fix it and please call the front desk.
