The front desk told me that I could move to another room and when I opened the door - it was a suite!! What a great stay that made it, more room than I could have ever imagined. Also, I lost a makeup jar in the first room, nothing important but I asked the front desk clerk to look for it anyway. Again, when I returned to my room (suite!) there was a letter from the clerk on the desk, saying that he was sorry but he was unsuccesful in locating my item and to call housekeeping with any questions I may have. This was a very impressive.touch. Finally, the concierges, Ed, John, Bill were all amazing and so helpful with everything. When I returned at the end of each day, the front desk always greeted me with "Welcome back." I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in S.F. for its excellent location, comfort and above all service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CancunCrew
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel in a very good location. Street noise is somewhat of a problem, but I think most hotels in the city have that problem. The rooms were on the small side but had what you needed (fridge, coffee pot, TV and safe) and ours had a King Bed. Hotel staff was nice and polite. The parking garage attendent wasn't very polite when we entered the garage, when I asked to retrieve eye glasses later in the day and when we left. His actions cost him about $20 in tips.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: vnb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery for about a week and found it to be the perfect spot for us. It's conveniently located (less than a block from Union Square and a cable car stop). Our room (in the premier section) was comfortable and spacious. The only two negatives [(1) getting to the premier section of the hotel is a bit convoluted (via stairs or herky-jerky wheelchair lift) and (2) the concierge was marginally helpful] would not dissuade me from returning to the hotel. The Daily Grill is attached to the hotel and made for a convenient tasty breakfast (included) before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location but...”
Reviews.Author: Lynda59
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference that was based out of this hotel. The location in Union Square was great - walking distance to great shopping and convenient to public transportation. The hotel, though, appears to be a converted motel with outdoor corridors. We had the "premier" section which meant walking up stairs, then across the pool area before catching an elevator to the next floor, crossing the area outside area again to get to our room. This was not expected and it was not easy with luggage. (The bellman uses a service elevator that guests cannot use) Also not expected was the noise level, with door slamming all evening long and large groups of people by the pool even at 2:00am. Other guests in our group had the same issue. Where is security?? I would rate the room as average, but the bed was very, very comfortable. Only advantage to premier level was free internet and 2 free bottles of water (which were never replaced). The overall service though at the hotel was very good. Service at the restaurant though was very poor. I probably would not stay at this hotel again unless I had a very, very low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a central location .”
Reviews.Author: katiepops64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Handlery for 2 days and we found the hotel to be perfect for what we needed . Breakfast at the daily grill was fantastic .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HAeBA
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here for only two days on our Californian vacation. We booked petit room but got upgraded to bigger one. Room was fine, thou bed was quite small, and we are not big people. Room was clean but it smelled a bit weird and that was only down side to it. Staff was very friendly and location was GREAT. Our room was facing other rooms but we didn't care and it was quiet which was the benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: pglaefke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our two boys 5 and 7 spent a weekend in San Francisco and stayed at the Handerley. There was a little mix up with our room (they were putting doubled pane windows in the room we wanted) They found us a room that we ended up being even Happier with. The staff was wounderful and went out there way to make sure we were happy even though they were busy at the front desk. Anything we needed and asked for not only did the staff help us but wanted to help us! Thank you to the front desk, valets, room service at the pool and the maids they all were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “to small for the price”
Reviews.Author: chamaco_caliente
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, clean, shower is small, but this hotel is not cheap, they are charging you for the location, so itâ€™s not worth the price, the building is a classic (old.. really really old building), you can stay at a cheaper bigger nicer room if you choose a hotel near the SF airport and just take the train in to the city...

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Union Square SanFran - Best Value out there!”
Reviews.Author: pbedenver
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the SanFran Handlery before, and specifically returned to this hotel. The reasons are Fantastic location, and most definitely the Best Value in the area. Staff was absolutely wonderful. Front desk and concierge were immensely engaging and helpful. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Sarah8384
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery for four nights in April and found it to be a very pleasant experience. We had no problem with the bell boys who helped us with our luggage without being asked. Checkin staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. Room was lovely, very spacious and the bed was very comfy - the only thing is the aircon is a little noisy but I sleep through anything so it didn't bother me at all. There is a lovely little pool and pool area. Although we did not use the pool it was night to sit out there to get away from the hussle bussle of the city. The location was excellent and the concierge was very helpful with how to get around the city. All in all if you get a good rate for this hotel it is completely perfect and probably would stay again if ever in San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “A great and safe place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: Lindsayroy
Reviews.Content: What can one say... Outstanding comes to mind...we upgraded to the king premier room adjoining with friends whom we travelled with... Staff were awesome... Room was awesome... Food in the daily Grill room was awesome.... Close to all transport and tour buses... Close to restaurants and Starbuck cafe's.... Would I stay there again...you bet I would and will!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ollies48
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a clean hotel with great beds and perfect location, then the Handlery in Union Square is where you want to be. I always look at the reviews of hotels before I book and the reviews on here where accurate. The desk staff looked after all of our needs, offered great suggestions for what to see in the limited time there. The best part, it's a door or two down from Lefty O'Dooles!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravcl
Reviews.Content: this hotel is expensive so try to book early and get a deal...its clean but small..but thats SF so you should be happy that atleast its nicely equipped, very clean and has a super location..we got the room right away which was great ..no waitg......i dont mind going back there again....has great eateries nearby and you have macys.....that makes ur stay more enjoyable and also you always feel surrounded by people an lively atmosphere so that a good feelg if you are there for the first time.......always look at google map and see what other hotels,eateries,malls are close by so u knw how good that area is....

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Orville104
Reviews.Content: The Handlery offers a great location (one block off Union Square), with clean and modern rooms. However, our A/C was not working properly which did adversely affect our sleep. Otherwise, we found the hotel to be quite good.I completed an online survey upon our return home, noted the poor condition of the A/C and within two days I received a personal email from Mr. Handlery that the problem had been fixed. (The note was a nice gesture but it would have been better if he had offered a discount of some kind upon our next visit as we are frequent visitors to "the City.") Regardless, the hotel staff was courteous, and the breakfast, which was part of our package, at the adjoining grill was also very good. The wait staff at the grill was unusually courteous! We will try this hotel once more, in spite of our A/C difficulties on our next trip to SF as we feel that the value is a good one for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: charmedsisters
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 14th-18th April 2011 and found the hotel perfect for our stay. The location was excelent a 1 min walk to union square where Macey's and other well known stores are located, the tram turntable was a 5 min walk away. Also the open top city sightseeing bus leaves directly oppersite Macey's. We had a nice large room overlooking the pool which was very quiet and comfy(we stayed in the premier side of the hotel not the historic). We also had breakfast included in the price which made it good value for money (I can recomend the waffle and maple syrup) The staff were friendly and helpful. Plenty of places to eat in the area if you fancy a walk out of an evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: artyart84
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, friendly staff. The room was small but suited us as we were hardly there. Clean, Comfortable bed and pillows. Computer access in the lobby $5 for 20 minutes, worked well for us. Steps away from union Square and tram stop. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and very accommodating staffi”
Reviews.Author: Lelonline
Reviews.Content: The downtown location just along the street from Union Square is fantastic and the hotel represents great value in this area. We had a double queen bed room and requested the newer part of the hotel (even though it doesn't have the same charm) as this is quieter and affords a better nights sleep. We actually requested a change of room after checking in, as the one we'd been given was right next to very noisy elevators and people coming and going. Our second room was fine and noise was no problem. Staff were very helpful and pleasant about us making this move. Our new room was clean, and the bathroom well appointed with top of the line toiletries. Those considering the Handlery should be aware that the interior of the rooms is getting a bit dated and the hotel is showing its age. That said, it did not bother us as it was clean, warm and the staff, particularly the doorman Herve, were so pleasant. For a hotel in this price range and in this great location, you'd be hard pushed to find better.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the Premium Suites - No Need for Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: AmyLee06
Reviews.Content: Yes to get a feel of the real night life of San Francisco, then spend a night or two in the Family suite on the Geary Street side of the Handlery. Its an experience everyone needs to hear (hay its San Fran after all). Then after your second night of falling asleep to drums performed by the local street performer, ask for an upgrade to the Premium Suites overlooking the swimming pool. The lovely Catherine (Front desk manager) was very helpful with moving my family into the Premium suites (not a problem at all), O'Farrell Street. We spent our last three nights of our one week stay, here in the Premium suite at the Handlery, and it is absolutely beautiful. Free wifi as well. Thankyou Catherine, and Thankyou as the room here is roomy, bathroom is great and the bed is sooo comfortable. Thumbs up from me and my three kids. And much quieter on the this side.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: cprr143
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with clean rooms. VERY loud city noise-bring some ear plugs and it will help. The hotel is situated in a great place with some good views if you don't mind hearing the horns beeping and sirens blaring during the night

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great staff and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: glenn1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 5-month old daughter, stayed recently at the Handlery. The hotel staff really went above and beyond in their friendliness and helpfulness. Lawrence at the bell station was extraordinarily thoughtful and helpful to us as we were attempting to check in with our little one and the small mountain of equipment we needed to bring along to change/feed/entertain her. At check in, the desk was extremely helpful in changing us from a single queen bed to two double beds room (we found earlier on in the trip how helpful that extra bed is when you have a little one) and placing us in a room away from the noisy street. Another example of the amazing service, was that my wife and I were talking to ourself about getting a bottle ready for our little one, and hoping that there was a microwave in the room (there was not). The staff must have heard us, because following our check-in and dropping off luggage in the room, an electric tea kettle magically appeared in our room while were out getting our own dinner. That simple act of kindness and thoughtfulness helped immeasurably in preparing formula for our little one later that evening when we were tired after a long day of travel. The room itself was immaculately clean, with nice features and fittings. The mattresses were a bit spongy for my tastes, but that's likely a matter of personal preference. The location can't be beat as you're literally only a few dozen steps from Union Square. One of the cable car lines terminates about 2 blocks from the hotel, so getting across town to Fisherman's Wharf or other attractions is simple. Chinatown is a few blocks away as well (uphill unfortunately) so you can get a good meal or cheap tourist trinkets there. Parking is reasonably priced ($39/day, with us getting a special that reduced that by a further 50%) with unlimited in-out privileges; which is something that costs twice as much in most other places (and probably a third or less of what it would be in NYC or Chicago). Note for those with baby strollers or in wheelchairs, getting from the garage to the hotel proper does involve some stairs, unless you utilize a freight style-elevator which was probably retrofitted to comply with Americans with Disabilities Act and is a bit slow and claustrophobic. The hotel does have a pool (open air) and restaurant available as well. Overall, the Handlery compared well to the (much more expensive) J.W. Marriott which I stayed at for business my last time in San Francisco, and would have no hestitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “EXcellent service, comfy bed, good food - what more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: Susan612500
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with a high standard of service. The reception staff and conceirge were quick, efficient and soon helped us work out the transport system, where to go and what to do in SF. The location in Union Square, is good for shops, trams, etc. Our room was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean, with a very comfortable bed - no view, but it was quiet, so peaceful and the champagne and nibbles in our room when we arrived (our 40th wedding anniversary) was a lovely surprise. No bath, but large bathroom with shower and dressing table. We ate in the Daily Grill, attached to the Hotel, which had a good choice â€“ in fact, really good food and service - and a different selection to others - I liked the spicy meat loaf â€“ portions were big though! Overall, we thought the Hotel was excellent and would definitely want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!! Went out of their way to make our stay memorable!”
Reviews.Author: 25thannivtrip
Reviews.Content: Had a bottle of champagne, bag of snacks & card for our 25th anniversary!! Nice rooms & very helpful. Flight was late getting in, so didn't have as much time to explore. They suggested an easy walk to Chinatown and Union Square. Location is great and safe. Just a block away from all the car rental places. After renting a car for a week we came back to SF for 3 more nights. Stayed at a different hotel and every time we walked by the Handlery, we kept wishing we were staying there instead!! We had a king room and was very nice and spacious!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: Bethlib
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to San Francisco from March 26th-April 2nd and stayed at the Handlery Hotel. It is in a busy downtown location in the Union Square area. We purchased a package through Travelocity and upgraded the room to a premier king. We were so glad that we did because we had a large room with a sitting area and a good sized bathroom with an extra make-up area and mirror. Our room was on the second floor facing the pool area. We truly appreciated the location of our room and the ability to spread out a little. While in San Francisco, we rode the cable car to the Hyde Street Pier, sailed out to Alcatraz for a day tour, explored a bit of Chinatown, went to the Mission Dolores, walked on Haight Street to Golden Gate Park, saw a bit of the de Young Museum, and took a boat trip to see the Golden Gate bridge. We were also fortunate that my husband's friend came and stayed a couple of days in San Francisco (also at the Handlery!) and drove us to Monteray in his vehicle to view the 17 mile drive in Pebble Beach. We enjoyed our time in San Francisco and I appreciate the kindness of the staff at the Handlery. They brought up extra pillows for my husband and took our luggage up to our room when we arrived at about 12:00 midnight. I would highly recommend anyone to stay at the Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for stop over in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: glennis72
Reviews.Content: We had a three day /two night stop over in SF and the Handlery was perfect. Excellent service and spacious clean comfortable rooms. A few steps from the main shops(Maceys etc) in Union Sq. (Visit the top kitchen shop Williams -Somoma a real treat beautiful displaysand products) Getting about is easy the hotel is round the corner from the cable car terminus., trolley car stops, BART and open top tour buses The Dining Room (The Daily Grill) served hearty and healthy breakfasts Don't be put off by the name it transformed into a really good restaurant with a buzzy atmosphere in the evening ( Consequently a good idea to book) Friendly reliable concierge service sorts out luggage and taxis on your last day. SF is beautiful. Get at least a two day pass and ride the transport system The area of Fishermans Wharf is tatty crowded -take aways and souveniors - Not to my taste . Ride instead to Hyde pier quieter, and beautifully restored heritage pier . Use Red and white ferry to see the views from the Bay and if you are there as we were on St Patricks Night enjoy the proliferation of green hats, wigs and party time in the bars

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations; good location”
Reviews.Author: SusNana2005
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Handlery based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. Hotel is in the heart of San Francisco and close to transportation. Noise from adjoining room was loud one night, but I brought earplugs. Staff were accommodating and friendly. Mr. Handlery left a welcome note and gift bag in our room upon arrival. Nice touch. The Grill next door was more than adequate for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: corgi47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery in March 2011. It is a nice hotel, right in the middle of where you should be in S.F. Union Square across the road. Macyâ€™s just a bit further. An Irish pub 2 doors up. After coming from 3 different hotels that had huge rooms with huge beds, it was a bit of shock to the system to open our door on the 7th floor and realise how small the room is. And the beds were tiny! Not even Queen size. I reckon they were king singles. No view at all. Our safe didnâ€™t work either. And the bathroom was tiny. Again, this could all be due to the previous huge rooms leaving an impression on us. Our 1st night was marred by the fire alarm screaming at 4am. No oneâ€™s fault, but standing in the cold S.F. rain at 4am seems to influence your opinions. Perhaps the most shocking thing is the $38.00 a night car parking fee. i dont know if this is a S.F. thing, or a common practise in inner city hotels, but i thought it was a ridiculous amount. I decided to hand my hire car in 2 days early instead of being slugged. Luckily, Hertz is right around the corner. The staff at the Handlery are perfect. Super friendly and helpful. The place itself is very clean and classy. Would I stay here again on my next trip to S.F.? Maybe. If I found somewhere in a similar good location, with maybe a bigger room and at about the same rate, I might stay elsewhere. But if I were to return, I would do so with no qualms. Just maybe, iâ€™d stay here first â€“ then go to the bigger rooms elsewhere in America.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: TheBrowneCouple
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Handerly and we loved it. The location was fabulous and the rooms were very nice and clean. We had a great view from our window of Geary Street and loved having the window open to hear the sounds of the city. We were able to walk to the shops on Union Square and also to the Curran Theatre that night. We went next door to the Daily Grill and had wonderful appetizers before the show and was very pleased. It was a fantastic stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, perfect location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Larsed
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nites, and above all, this hotel understands service. Everyone buys into the concept, from housekeeping staff, to security, to John (Concierge), and Catherine (Front office). The rooms are a bit dated, but work. The beds are comfortable (linens, pillows) the windows open, the location is absolutely prime, and for 3 stars, you won't find better value. I'll be back. They also have an affiliation with a great gym 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: parisparisparis
Reviews.Content: We have travelled all over the world, and have never met such arrogant concierges. Isn't it their job to be helpful to weary travellers? The hotel is just okay: rooms cozy, but small; very loud street noise which makes sleeping rather difficult; good location to Union Square. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happy_in_San_Fran
Reviews.Content: My room was very cozy and nice. However, I had a hard time getting the temp right. The hotel is located in a prime spot, with easy access to shopping, restaurants and public transportation. The majority of the service was excellent with the exception of the conseiger. He was quite rude and unhelpful. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NatsyLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in Oct 2010. Our room, in the older part of the hotel, was nice. Yes, it was definitely smaller than the average hotel room one finds in the States. It was more like European sized room. The room had been given a make over but some things were a bit old. I guess they kept them for character. One complaint was that they did not have a gym. I thought it would have been ready but it wasn't. You can use a nearby gym but you have to pay. Another gripe was the noise of the rain. Our window opened up to an atrium which meant that we didn't hear city noise even though you're so central. But their was a window sill outside on to which the rain made a very irritating tapping noise. This really got to me as I was struggling with jet lag. But, as I said, no street noise. Our room was average - I'd give it 3 out of 5. The location is great though. It's so central and convenient. Everything is right downstairs. This brings up my rating to 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location & value”
Reviews.Author: MisterGreen
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews here, we chose this hotel for a two-night stay following our return from Hawaii before returning east. It was the right choice located just across the street from the St. Francis at Union Square. Every employee we came into contact with were friendly and courteous. The concierge was especially helpful in giving us advice on getting around. (The street car is just a short walk down to Market Street, in addition to the cable car which is obviously close.) I can't say enough about good things about the staff. Upon leaving, I called the desk for help with our luggage. He asked if I needed a cab. I told him yes, we were going to the airport. It was raining. The bellman went outside and got us a mini van big enough to hold our luggage. He had the cab pull around back to the garage. When we got downstairs, the cab was waiting in the street. The bellman went out and told the driver to back into the garage so that we would not get wet. He then loaded our bags. How nice! The rooms were immaculate, the beds comfortable and the hotel quiet. All at a very fair price in a very expensive city. Thanks TripAdvisor for helping me find this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: clarke3011
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is a great hotel! Centrally located - near BART, cable car, and Union Square - it couldn't have been better. The staff was extremely helpful and willing to assist in any way possible. The king room with the city view and balcony was large and a great deal compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & great value compared to other similar hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Crouchinho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights midway through out honeymoon and found this hotel to be excellent. Parking is pricey at $38 per night but this is comparable with all other central hotels in San Francisco and we got a good deal on bookit.com with half price parking. The room itself was very nice and modern, although the bathroom could do with some updating. In terms of location this hotel is literally 1 minute walk from Union Square and it only took us 20 mins to walk down to Fishermans Wharf which was great. Plenty of restaurants close by, you can easily walk to Chinatown / Little Italy for your evening meal. Shopping is also on your doorstep. A special thanks to the front desk staff who sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne which I assume was because I put a note on our booking that we were on our honeymoon - very much appreciated! Overall this hotel is hard to fault bearing in mind the price and reduced parking cost.

Reviews.Title: “We had an EXCELLENT stay at the Handlery Union Square Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2leashes
Reviews.Content: This was a combination business/leisure trip for one night. My husband was timing a 5k for a group of conventioneers early in the A.M on Thursday. So, we arrived at 4 P.M. on Wednesday, in time to have dinner at the Cheesecake Factory. :) Our room was on the newer side "Premier" over the garage. Perfect location overlooking O'Farrell St. We had a spacious, King Premier balcony room. I just LOVED the location and it was on the 3rd floor, just as I requested. And, I really looked forward to the balcony! We were not disappointed! I just LOVE to watch the hustle and bustle of the city streets below. I had contacted Jon Handlery a few days before letting him now how impressed I am that he replies to everyone here on Trip Advisor. I also told him that my husband and I were spending one night at the Handlery for business and to celebrate our anniversay a month late. Next thing you know, he wrote me back even though he was out of the country, it turns out! And, he had his assistant contact me asking what we preferred--white or red wine, or champagne. So, when we walked into our room we were pleasantly greeted with a chilled bottle of bubbly and a bag of snacks and bottled water. And, a nice note. What a WONDERFUL gesture!! Thank you so much, Mr. Handlery! I loved the size of the room. It was perfect having a small couch and easy chair, as well as the desk. My husband needed to access the internet for business. It worked great! I notice the couch opens up as a bed, so there would have been room for our daughter! I really was impressed with the amenities in our room. Also, it really wasn't loud at night, even though we were facing the busy street. It wasn't a problem at all! I realize it wasn't a weekend. But, I love the city, so it wouldn't have bothered me. I loved the lighted make-up mirror and the little powder room, complete with cushioned, rolling stool. A very nice touch. The next morning there was a complimentary SF Chronicle newspaper at our door. And, after my husband got back from the 5k race, we both had a cup of coffee in the room. I would have preferred those little liquid half and half containers over the powdered creamer, however. :) But, the coffee was just fine, otherwise. Strong enough, too! The parking garage was a cinch. After initially working our way through the maze of stairs and hallways to arrive at the lobby, we never had to go over that way again. :) Since we stayed above the garage, it was easy just to take the elevator down and exit out on O'Farrell or pick up the car if needed. Very convenient. The ONLY thing I would change in our room is the MATTRESS and pillows. And, I mean the ONLY thing! :) I have to admit, I wasn't comfortable, although my husband slept like a baby. I'm used to my own feather pillow, as well as the less-poofy pillows I use against my back and between my knees. I also have THE most comfortable mattress in the world at home. Unfortunately, the mattress at the hotel seemed to dip toward the middle so I stayed more toward the edge. Again, I'm so used to my own bed, it's just hard to compare! The best hotel bed I ever slept in was a Heavenly Bed in Seattle a few years back. Oh my! I felt cradled in a firm, but gentle cloud. :) Handlery's bed-issue did NOT cause me to give it any less than 5 stars, though! Everything else about our stay was beyond perfect! That balcony was the selling point for ME! I will GLADLY book the same room or one close by at the Handlery Union Square again! Your family has really done an exceptional job with this hotel. I'm so glad that it's STAYING in the family, too! Thanks once again for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Grateful guest”
Reviews.Author: Coopers4
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers about the fantastic location of this hotel - but what really impressed me was receiving in the mail a cheque for the several hundred dollars that my dopey teenage son left in his room and was too embarrassed to own up to. For that honesty I would stay here again any time. The rooms we stayed in were in the historic wing and although the beds are very comfortable if you are a light sleeper I would recommend requesting a room that does not face the street as there is a fair bit of noise through the night. It offers great value for money though and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: vegasmommy60
Reviews.Content: Not only is it a lovely old Hotel the location can't be beat. Tons of Diners, Cafes, Restaurants and Bars all in walking distance. Lots of Galleries right out the front door. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: whmurray
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great value. Friendly and accommodating staff. Older property, nicely restored. All the modern and expected amenities and conveniences. Wireless Internet, fairly priced. ( Actually, it assumed one device while I had three. When I asked about it, they volunteered a passcode as a remedy. Lots of power outlets. The restaurant, The Daily Grill, is excellent and also a great value. Moved here from a Marriott that was not as well located and was twice the price. Marriott staff had nothing on the Handlery staff

Reviews.Title: “great location if you love shopping”
Reviews.Author: meljw98
Reviews.Content: There is a BART stop from the train station to near the hotel. It is just on the corner of Union Square. This is where all the shops are located. There are also some nice restaurants/diners nearby as well as bars with live music and roof top bars in other hotels. Definitely shop in Macys and get the 10% tourist discount card (from the top floor customer services). Public transport is very good - there is the $5 tram or $2 trams/busses. Easy to get to Fishermans Wharf, the tourist area. I would not recommend the tour bus as a means of transport as its expensive, restrictive in hours and only goes one direction in the city. But do use it if you would like a spoken or pre-recorded guide of the city and making a day or half day of it. There are a couple of choices of routes but one ticket only covers the one route. Longer routes make journys more long winded. Consider the direction of the bus route before commiting to buying a day ticket, which is around $30. The bike route is recommended and caters for all abilities - you can do the entire route or just cycle part of it in one direction and take it on the ferry back to the hire shop. The room is basic but clean with nice bay windows overlooking the street. There is noise though as it is located in a busy area. There is no free wifi in this hotel but overall the hotel is good value.

Reviews.Title: “I've found THE place to stay when in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: phranky
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that currently I'm wheelchair-bound. So, I have stayed at many hotels that did the bare minimum to address my needs. That's why the Handllery was such a delight. It was but several blocks from my destination, Moscone West. And the staff addressed (if not anticipated) my every need. You wouldn't think that a room of its size would be able to accommodate a power chair. Not only was it fine but I was able to navigate throughout the room without any problems whatsoever. Their were kind and courteous, and gave me a hand when I needed some help. I will most definitely be looking forward to my next trip to the Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, clean rooms, and I felt very safe in the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say if you are looking to stay in San Francisco, and you are looking at the Union Square area this is a great option. I have no major complaints about this hotel. I gave cleanliness a five but I have a few complaints the elevator lobby at the parking garage is dirty and has been since my last visit, in fairness it is most likely impossible to keep clean but some new carpet and chairs would go a long way. The paint in the room was fine but it looked like a five year old cut in the corners (now that we all have access to the DIY channel we are all experts). I would have appreciated it if the clerk at the front counter let me know when checking in there was no view or no bath tub. By no view I mean no view, these old buildings sometimes have windows that open up into a opening that Is an air vent, and no tub fine but had the counter clear told me about the air shaft view and no tub I would have gladly paid more for a different room. I checked in Monday night and the place did not look full so I know there were different rooms available. I gave a four on value because I felt the price I payed was a little high for the room I received, I stay 1-2 nights in SF about 7 times a year and I day trip about once a month and I have a good idea what rooms should go for. I have a tip for first time visitors to San Francisco stay in the union square area, you can take public transportation to other parts of the city for your excursions. If you get a good room you can open your window and see and hear the cable cars going by. I will give you a warning there are some bad neighborhoods not far from union square. There is also a very bad homeless problem, just ignore them and they will leave you alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fish7_2-3
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I celebrated our birthdays with a stay at the Handlery Union Square Hotel. Our room was quite nice...beautifully decorated, spacious and clean. The staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful. The location was great as we were able to walk to the Curran Theater and great shopping. We enjoyed eating at the restaurant in the hotel, and the Irish pub across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: rexcab
Reviews.Content: This stay was a mix of a business trip which I extended as a leisure trip over the weekend. I knew it was in a great location near Union Square, so I didn't hesitate to book a room here after getting a good room rate. When I checked in and went to my room, I was at first somewhat disappointed. It was in the older section of the hotel, 2nd floor, next to the elevators and the ice machine. After I entered the room, my mood brightened a bit, because it looked nice, had a small fridge, and a surprisingly bigger bathroom than I was expecting. Then I opened the window blinds to check out the view...disappointment again. No view of the city...only the roof of what I think was the Daily Grill restaurant and other rooms of the hotel. I was afraid to tell my wife about this room, as she was flying in to meet me here for the weekend. As I laid down to sleep I began to realize that I am not hearing any of the street noises that are present in this area. I began to see a big benefit to the location of this room Throughout the 5 night stay, I hardly heard the elevator or ice machine as well. This room is a gem! When I come back, I'm going to see if I can get this room again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable+++”
Reviews.Author: carmenAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay here Jan5th-8th. The main purpose of our trip was to get over jet lag & use San Francisco as a curtain-raiser to our ski holiday. The Handlery Union Square fitted the brief perfectly. We had 2 rooms in the Historic Section, small but beautiful "bones" & immaculately clean. Beds were comfortable ,& rooms not noisy ( we were on 6th floor). Staff we dealt with were friendly & efficient. We had breakfast included in our tariff & this proved to be yummy,fresh & quite streamlined so we were able to get on with our day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for short stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: SuSu49022
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights there after several days in the wine country. We liked the location and friendly staff (except for one guy). It is a great location for tourists - easy to get to the key spots. Less than 1 blk from Powell St cable car. Right at Union Sq. Only 2-3 blks to Market to catch street cars and other public transp. We had not expected the adjoining restaurant to be so good. My husband thought it was the best meal we had all week. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: RugbyBoyBC
Reviews.Content: Our two day stay was reasonably good. Hotel location is great for tourists. Rooms away from the street are quiet but those overlooking the street can be quite noisy all night. Staff were friendly and attentive. Value for dollars spent was also good except for the expensive parking. Our only complaint were that the hotel needed some TLC. Both toilet and bathroom sink didn't work properly. The room and hallway also needed some attention. Overall, we were fine with our stay but would look around next time to see if there were better options within the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Location cannot be beat”
Reviews.Author: adrianmeli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is downtown in union square so the location could not be better in my opinion. You are close to everything and the area is a lot of fun. The hotel is a great value for the area without a doubt and the people there are very nice but you should be aware the interior of the rooms is old and the hotel shows it age. It didn't bother me, but it is not a new construction by any means. I barely spent any time there so I just liked being close to everything and at the price i found it online I could not have been happier. - Adrian Meli

Reviews.Title: “Good people at a great location with excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: rrm9
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there for 3 days with my two teenaged daughters. It came highly recommended by a close friend and my brother. The Handlery did not disappoint. We stayed in the "premier" section and were delighted with the room and all the helpful and friendly employees. The Daily Grill restaurant is adjacent and has very good food. The location could not be better for shopping or just relaxing and people watching in Union Square. A cable car stop is right at the corner and Market St is a short two blocks away. A great place to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: lgtraveler42
Reviews.Content: I was booking a weekend trip for a friend's birthday and wanted to find something close to Union Square. I came across a great deal for the Handlery and after reading many positive reviews, decided to book a stay for Saturday night...very happy with the decision! The location of the hotel is AMAZING. We actually stayed in Fisherman's Wharf on Friday and were able to take a trolley practically to the front door of the Handlery the next morning. The hotel is surrounded by little galleries and restaurants, as well as department stores such as Macy's. A few blocks away is the Bart station, which was a very convenient, inexpensive way to return to the airport on Sunday. We had wanted to stay in something other than a chain, and the Handlery has the character of an older hotel but is still very clean and comfortable. The beds were great and the room a good size (especially given the number of reviews seen on other hotels about the small rooms in San Francisco). Amenity wise, they had computers available with Internet access ($5 for a 20 minute card) and a printer, and the Daily Grill is attached for those who don't want to leave for Breakfast. We also loved that there was a heated pool (a nice surprise in January!) What really set the hotel apart though was our interaction with the President, Jon Handlery. I had written to Mr. Handlery explaining that this was a special weekend...not only did he call me that afternoon, but came down to welcome us personally at check-in and later had something sent up to the room. It definitely left an impression and made our stay that much more special. We look forward to staying there again next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, central location”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneMegan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights Jan 3-Jan 6 2011. There seemed to be a lot of Australian tourists like us using the hotel, most of us had booked through Australian travel agents. It's centrally located right near Union Square which is centre of city. Lots of shopping and restaurants close by. The hotel is old, however, clean and maintained. The air conditioning in our room was very noisy (could not sleep with it on) and took some time to heat â€“ cold outside, so getting the room warm seemed to take a while (30-45mins). The bathroom is small and clean. Glass shelves over basin â€“ wow, watch your head â€“ easy to hit your head on the shelf if you want to lean into the basin. The bed was comfortable, though housekeeping seemed to never tuck the sheets in correctly on the bed! At the base of the bed the sheets were always coming out. We also had a few itches and a number of other visitors mentioned same issue â€“ bites on their body. So not sure if we had some unwanted guests in the bed with us. The staff/team at the Handlery are very polite and helpful. Nothing ever a problem, any issues or questions quickly offer solution or answer. Well presented. We were given complimentary breakfast vouchers each morning, which was a nice surprise as we did not realise these were in our room cost. Three choices of three set meals and tea or coffee. All food OK (eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, waffles, cereal, yoghurt) though meals and coffee was not at hot, (lukewarm) on the first two mornings. Third morning was a lot better. My vote : this is an OK place to stay. The Handlery are close to having a great little spot to stay, and if the hotel could improve on the above mentioned items they could turn this into a much more appealing experience for their visitors.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: PalesaM81
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 days with my sister and while the hotel is pretty good - the location is what totally sells it. right next to macys and along a good shopping row. great places to eat around the hotel and easy access to the hop-on-off bus tours. hotel layout was strange though.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, comfortable beds, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RobinBonn
Reviews.Content: All in all, a great choice for a short stay in San Francisco. The location is great, almost right on Union Square. Handy to transport, shopping and night life. The rooms are tastefully furnished. My only gripe would be size of the bathroom, it was so small the basin couldn't even fit in. Our room was quite noisy with constant street noise (sirens etc.) but being in downtown San Fransisco, that's hardly the hotels fault. The staff were very helpful and polite and I would definitely choose this hotel again for a short stay. For a longer stay I might opt for a hotel in a quieter neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff, Super location.”
Reviews.Author: crashmandave
Reviews.Content: We wanted to try one of the other hotels in the area rather than the usual â€œBigâ€� chain hotels and Iâ€™m convinced we hit the jackpot.. This is a great older hotel with all the amenities and upgrades. Itâ€™s by no means a small place and can hold there own toe to toe with the big boys. The staff were friendly, helpful and a pleasure to work with. The Handlery had everything you could need in a hotel. It was steps from Union square, a great wine shop, Kutetos restaurant and many, many cafÃ©s. Of course if you want there were two starbucks less than one minute from the frond door. We were on the fifth floor with a street view room. I loved that the windows opened up all the way and gave us a great little breeze, very refreshing. The elevators were fine and went from the lobby to the fifth floor with out any issues, so I donâ€™t know what else you would need from a hotel. They have a restaurant attached (The Daily Grill) so you donâ€™t have to go anywhere if your not in the mood.. All of the hotel chains charge for wifi service so that shouldnâ€™t be a surprise to frequent travelers thatâ€™s why I have an air card. If you absolutely need internet service when traveling maybe you should look into an air card so you donâ€™t have to rely on spotty or no service. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone going to the Union Square area. I will be back for sureâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: djockcally
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we was told it was a 3 star hotel but was very close to Union Square. Well close was an understatement, out the doors, turn right and 20 yards down was the square. Just round the corner was the main Tram stop, which takes you straight down to Fishermans Wharf, or any where else you fancy. The bedrooms were very nice with extremely large comfortable beds.Only real criticism was the price of a breakfast at the hotel, very expensive. I would definately eat outside of the hotel. Overall we would definately book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location.........”
Reviews.Author: TNtraveler1998
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and have no complants. 1/2 block to Union Station, Cable Car stop, and excellent food. Eat at Lefty O'Douls next door, great food. Shop Union Square, China Town, and ride the elevator at St Francis. Rooms were not huge but we only sleep here so not an issue. The beds could use an update, but were were so tired it didn't matter. Still no complaints. We did the park and stay option and it worked well. Excellent vallet staff that were promt and courtious. We did not move the car much and used the MUNI pass for 3 days. Worked great. Rode Cable cars, buses, and electric trolleys, lots of fun. Handlery is very authinic and historic, classic San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience at the Handlery Union Square”
Reviews.Author: FredFromPerthWestAus
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, stayed in the historic section which had a charming character feel. Staff were generally excellent, and very courteous, place was very clean and tidy, rooms in particular were very clean, neat and comfortable, and looked after to a high level by service staff. The Staff's responsiveness to service requests were top grade. There were little toughes which made you feel very welcome eg. a nice christmas stocking with goodies on the door knob when you woke up on Christmas morning, It seems clear to me that the bosses in this establishment have put in place processes which help it to run very well. Daily Grill resturant associated with hotel is top grade for all meals. We were even able to meet with the president of the Handlery establishments, Mr Jon Handlery - a very personable, approachable, and knowledgeable man indeed. Be aware that as the hotel is in an excellent location right on union square with all the shops, restaurants, accessible transport and tourist attractions right on your door step, the hustle and bustle of a city center needs to be expected and enjoyed, and if you are not happy with that, you can undoubtedly find other hotels in somewhat less convenient locations.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel expierence I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: lorieandjason
Reviews.Content: I took my son here for his birthday on December 20 and 21st and we had a wonderful trip. The hotel was beautiful and all the employees we had contact with were exceptional and very helpful. The Handlery Hotel really made our trip special and made both my son and I feel like we were part of their family. I would definately recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back myself. The location was great, we felt very safe and all the stores were an easy walk from the Hotel. We had dinner at the Daily Grill and the food was outstanding - I had the fish special (Hazelnut crusted Mahi Mahi that was out of this world and my son chose the marinated skirt steak that he absolutely loved).

Reviews.Title: “Thank God I only stayed for one night”
Reviews.Author: Dina0626
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in this hotel during a trip to San Fransisco. Good Points - The location is great - The historic feel of the hotel is pretty neat - The staff is very nice Downsides - The room we stayed in smelled of must - The bathroom was extremely outdated - Our sheets where visibly dirty, we requested new sheets, they were dirtier that the first set. The third set of sheets were at least visibly clean. I also would not recommend the restaurant in the hotel, although the staff was nice, the food was very bland. There are plenty of better places to grab a bite nearby.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: Pasha_irvine
Reviews.Content: I'm not a tough reviewer but i can't say i loved everything about this hotel. The location is awesome, reception people are adorably polite and the service was fast. The only problem is the noise you here from the street, which could be resolved by changing the window frames! It was really close to Union square and a lot of good restaurants around it. The mini bar was empty !!!! Or i may say, there was no mini bar in my room which is quite ODD!! TV was nice and i easily found my fave shows on it. Room service was good, I loved the Arabian coffee they put in rooms ! Internet is really low that you can't watch any netflix movies online! ( I used my iphone to check my emails - it was way, way way faster ) I can say if you are staying there for fanciness don't do it, go to Hilton which is only 20 dollars more a night and is right in front of the street ( though Hilton is bottom of a hotel ! ) but if you are staying here for business it is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to spend a holiday weekend in the city!”
Reviews.Author: JaxNana
Reviews.Content: Four women shared a room and didn't feel cramped at all. Parked the car and didn't use it at all, and we were centrally located for anything we needed. Able to get a taxi right outside the door. Hotel staff were very pleasant and professional. Since we were on the south side of the hotel, Starbucks was only steps away from the elevator near the garage. You are in the heart of San Francisco, so of course, you might hear some city noise, but hey, isn't that part of the "city experience". Not loud enough to keep you awake, but enough so that you know you are in the "heart of SF". Of course, Lefty O'Douls is just next door - with a piano bar . . . need I say more! If you need a late dinner or early breakfast (after leaving Lefty's), may I suggest the Pinecrest Diner a half a block away? Enjoy your stay - we will be back next year for a holiday weekend again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: msgtp
Reviews.Content: Travel extensively for business and pleasure, and the Handlery at Union Square is the worst hotel at which I've ever stayed. First "patti" from the hotel confused our dual reservation - 1 night personal, 5 nights business so that we nearly had to pay twice for 1 night. Second - was made aware of free wi-fi 3 days into our stay Third - extremely loud party scheduled directly below our room on a Tuesday night Fourth - no help with bags Fifth - colleagues offered complimentary coffee, papers, etc. But not offered to me until I asked forecfully Sixth - completely uncaring staff - examples Ed (an intern) attempted to put off my complaint about lack of equal comps for our company travel until I forced the issue by standing there until something was done I've got two night left here and don't see any improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bigdaddi0
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Handlery on the day the Giants won the World Series, so it was a lot of fun for the three nights we were there. You could not be more centrally located if you want to be on Union Squre, it is just a minutes walk from the hotel. Our room was very spacious and as we were husband, wife and adult daughter we needed a good size room. The only issue we had was the free wireless internet - it hardly ever worked, constantly dropping out. In the end I had to take my laptop down to the foyer to pick up the connection - not really a satisfactory situation. Other than that, everything else at the Handlery was fantastic. Just as an aside, we have stayed a few times in Union Square and have always used a shuttle or taxi to get ourselves to and from the airport, at quite a cost too. This time we caught the airport train and I must say this is definitely the way to go. It is only 30 minutes to the airport and costs just $8, and the station is right next to the cablecar turnaround at Powell St. No changing trains so not much chance of missing your stop. In future we'll always use the train.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy”
Reviews.Author: Louise30889
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Handlery 3 times and this last time was a poor service experience. We will not stay there again. The first two times it was through the Tony Bruno special and we had a great time and felt like "family" as John Handlery's video. I made a reservation for the Garden suite for November 19th as it was my partner's 50th birthday. I ordered champagne when we arrive (pre-ordered) first off I had to call the front desk to find out when it would arrive as no one relayed that to me. Second, when I went to draw a bath there were 2 different types of hair stuck to the bath tubs side. I opted out of making a big deal to keep the mood nice for my mate. Third and most disturbing was the fire alarm went off in the suite, we went out-side in the rain and the front desk called to say a maintance man would come up to check the alarm. He came, and said he thought it was dusty and then asked us if we were smoking in the room or had we showered and set off the alarm. I then decided to call the front dest to express my concerns of the alarm going off again and wanted to be assured it was functioning properly. I was treated like I was a thorne in her side and transfered to a mananger who said he's look into it and call me back. I never got a call back. I spent $405.00 for one night of poor service. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Connie12
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms, one premiere and one regular. We booked it through the KGO rate which included free parking. The premiere room was very nice. Two queen beds. Our room had an outside corrider overlooking the pool area so had to keep curtains closed. We received a free goody bag and two bottles of water. We also were given a code for free internet. Internet didn't work the last night. The amenities (shampoo, conditioner, soap) were different on then on the regular side. The regular room was pretty spacious. It had a little dip in the room so almost had two private areas and there was a TV in each area. The maid on the first day left a dirty kleenix and a wrapper in the middle of the end table but took the tip. My friends didn't tip after that. Their room looked over the heating and air conditioning units. Not a lot of noise from that. They didn't receive an internet code for free internet. They had two double beds. Overall we liked the hotel. It even rated well with my fancy, semi snobbish friend.

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated however nothing to rave about - beggars on the streets”
Reviews.Author: gdaypat
Reviews.Content: This is a standard hotel, nothing special. We ate breakfast in the cafe first morning but felt we were an inconvenience to the watered day. We were due t spend 5 nights in San Fran however left after three, the beggars are everywhere and follow you. We counted 10 while walking one block. We just didn't want to be there after seeing the tourist attractions. This hotel was ok but San Fran, wouldn't go back. We were advised to ignore the beggars however with them in your face and walking with you does not make a holiday. Back to the hotel wireless Internet is available in your room via an outside service provider, it kept dropping out. No refund as it is a direct debit to your card. I spent 2 hours trying to fix the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ThunderMtnKid
Reviews.Content: Would recommend to anyone. It's not too dear of a price and it's clean. Would stay again. Thundermtnkid.

Reviews.Title: “EXPENSIVE!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyTurk21
Reviews.Content: Hi guys, do not visit this hotel because it is crazy expensive, with a lot hidden costs and prices.The only mistake when you visit san fran! the staff in the hotel was not polite and the parking charges were very expensive!just get another hotel because u can`t relax here. i wish you a better hotel in san fran! see u!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ScrappyDoo255115
Reviews.Content: I cannot speak highly enough of the Handlery. We stayed here for 6 nights and did not want to leave. From the front desk to the beautiful Premier Queen room with a private little balcony overlooking the pool. A nice touch to be able to sit out on the balcony and have breakfast. I even had the pleasure of meeting Mr Handlery who was more than happy to have a chat. Mr Handlery even arranged for a late checkout for us due to our flight being late in the day. This was unexpected and a really nice way to leave our already high opinion of the Hotel. The staff look very smart in their uniforms and are also very helpful. The location was perfect. We are already planning our next trip and will be staying here again without a doubt. Thank you Handlery Hotel for making our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: Marishnosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nites in early october and absolutely loved it! We had a premiere king room, with balcony overlooking pool! Great to have to somewhere quiet to sit out and have a beer in the evening right in the middle of the city! The bed was awesome, seperate area with couch and chairs and a big TV and fridge. The only slight drawback was the room was quite a long walk from the street and there is some stairs to drag your case up, but I wouldnt let this put you off! You couldn't get a better location right on the square, The daily grill next door is great but very expensive for breakfast ( $8 for a bowl of cornflakes????!!) There's a nice diner on the corner 1 block up, or lefty's two doors down is cool too! My Second time at the handlery and hopefully not my last....higly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “It's a ok place”
Reviews.Author: Mikeman222
Reviews.Content: It's a ok place to stay at. When we first got there... We found a mustard stain on the floor... The beds were quite comfy and we all had good sleeps. The bathroom was a little small and the toilet was a little crooked. Very good location with very good resteraunts nearby.all in all.... It was a good hotel. Diffently has some room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: myseablue
Reviews.Content: The Handlery again met all expectations. The Hotel allowed us to park our vehicle early in the day so we could get started with our sightseeing. This was a first time staying in the newer section. Although we enjoyed the additional space, we truly missed the coziness and quaintness of the Historic section. We also missed the wonderful city views enjoyed in previous years. We've decided to return to the Historic section when we stay here again--which we undoubtedly will. The lively city noises are almost welcome--it's such a big part of the San Francisco experience. There's only one thing that was unpleasant. Our room (460) was right next to the elevator so we heard it operating non-stop. And it's somewhat noisy. But that did not deter us. The comfy beds and dreamy pillows quickly replaced the noise. Overall, our stay was super and we thank the Handlery staff for all the attention.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: LINNEY30
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed at this hotel as a stopover for three nights before visiting the Hawaiian Islands in October 2010. It was very clean, the staff were all very helpful,its not too expensive,its in a really good location but most importantly of all for me it was very quiet! We only paid for the cheapest rooms so we were very pleasantly surprised how spacious they were and there was a complimentary welcome pack of various snacks and drinks waiting for us in the room! As a base for sightseeing in San Francisco I highly recommend it!! (treat yourself to a glass of delicious champagne at the Gold Dust Bar nearby, its only $3.5 before 8.30pm and it was lovely!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingCowman
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of san francisco! Rooms we stayed in were clean and equipped with all amennities. Shirley of the reception was great and even gave us a room at 8am!!! Internet connection should be better if charged

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: zeacie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in October. We arrived earlier than expected but were pleasantly surprised to find our room ready. The Front Desk Manager was very helpful in checking us in to our rooms. He also filled in as concierge and bell hop for us because they were quite busy so it was very personalised service. Bought a 3 day muni pass which was valid for all public transport. Hotel right near Union Square, Macy's, Westfields. Cable car and electric bus stops are just down the block. Lots of restaurants nearby, ate lunch and dinner at the Daily Grill, food was great, service a little slow but overall fine. No Free WiFi which was a little dissapointing as 95% of the hotels on our 5 week trip had it, so a hotel of this standard I thought would have provided it. Our room was away from the street so it was very quiet but had no view (looked out onto other rooms). I would stay here again and recommend to other travellers for its location.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved the Handlery San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: jgrissomscott
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Handlery in san francisco. the location is fabulous (right at union square), the staff is helpful & friendly, the rooms are clean and nice (great sheets!) and it's a very good value. it's quiet, especially considering the location. we were there on a family vacation, but i wouldn't hesitate staying there on business, too. we couldn't have been happier with our stay and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - room a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Mrbiffo
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel is located one block from Union Square, the location is first rate. MUNI, MUNI Metro, Bart and cable cars are all nearby, I also found that there were plenty of shops and restaurants within easy reach. My room was very comfortable, the only criticism I would make is that my room facing onto Geary Street was very noisy at all hours. I would stay again if I the hotel could guarantee me a room which was not so noisy. (I would guess that there are many rooms which do not face onto Geary street.) On arrival and departure the bell hops and receptionist were very helpful as was the concierge during my stay. The hotel is connected to a restaurant, the Daily Grill, which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. I ate dinner at the bar one night and found the food to be pleasant along with the atmosphere. Breakfast was also good, although there are plenty of other places nearby if you want to go elsewhere. I paid extra to use the WiFi which was fast and reliable, there is a business center with computer in the lobby ( I believe that they charge) All in all a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice rooms, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: malliew2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was packed the weekend of the Nike Women's Marathon. The staff were totally overworked that weekend but were fantastic, responsive, helpful, and patient all weeekend. I would definitely stay there again. Great staff. Nice clean rooms (a little on the small side in the older section - two queen beds), comfortable beds, and nice decor. Good location, right off Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and View”
Reviews.Author: Janstar42
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful birthday weekend, while staying at the Handlery. The view of the cable cars going by, Union Square and the best shops. The room was charming with a huge flat screen. Tiny bathroom, but it was built a long time ago. The staff was friendly. The location was perfect for visiting the city. Two blocks from the beginning of the cable car location. We took the cable car to dinner near the wharf, for only $5. Way better than driving. We paid about 160 with free valet parking. A great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Joy255115
Reviews.Content: We statyed at the Handlery for 6 nights with 3 children. We are from NZ and had been on a holiday around California. Would say this was the best hotel for location, rooms and the suprise of getting 12 vouchers for breakfast. Location is perfect for catching the trams, shopping and the Bart station down the road. The family suite we had was a lot larger than we expected and was comfortable for a family of 5. We will stay here again on our next trip to visit family in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Worn with Tasteful Charm”
Reviews.Author: SBSTex
Reviews.Content: Handlery is in a great Union Square location and definitely shows its age, but rooms are spacious and very tastlefully appointed -- great bedding, attractive decor and very clean. Those looking for modern luxury may be disappointed, but for those who don't mind some attractive character, they will find this property charming. Adjacent restaurant and bar is very sophisticated, and high end art galleries are on same block. Then there's the iconic Lefty O'Doul's on the block -- a wonderful working class piano bar and late night amusement.

Reviews.Title: “what a fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: baby2512
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here from 5-9.10.10. From the minute of arrival we were treated as though we were the only ones in the hotel! The staff were so friendly and helpful. The room itself was right beside the pool, and was absolutely fantastic - clean tidy and quiet - just what the doctor ordered!!! The only down side of having a room beside the pool was although we had patio doors leading to it, smoking guests were allowed to sit here and smoke, and being non-smokers found this a little odd. Wouldn't really be able to have patio doors open. Breakfast in the mornings was second to none, and again the service was first class. The location of the hotel is spot on as well - right in the middle of all the shopping you can dream of, and not far from Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, Crab shacks, China Town - everything. Although word of warning, we did find the price of food quite high even for the simplest of things. Alcatraz is a must see, as is the open top bus tour of the city - well worth it. Oh yes, do remember to take a jacket for the evenings, it did get rather chilly to say the least!! We really did enjoy our stay here and would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun location”
Reviews.Author: SedonaAz_Mee
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the hotel. Our room was conveniently located in the Union square shopping area. The beds were comfortable, soaps/lotions were VERY nice, We would definitely stay there again. The staff working the parking garage were always courteous with us, especially considering how many times we took our truck in and out of the garage during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable central stop over”
Reviews.Author: Nowandthentraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in October in 2 king deluxe rooms travelling with my husband and another couple. We are all in our 30's. I loved this hotel. It was a great central location if you don't have a car. Heaps of great fashion shops and great places to eat all at our door step. The rooms were large and nicely furnished. The beds were so comfortable which was great as I am pretty fussy about that. We had a huge flat screen tv and a 2 seater couch in our room. Probably ask for a room not facing the street if you are staying on the weekend. We stayed on the street side during the week and it was fine as we weren't back in our rooms until about 10.30pm each night, but there was some street noise mainly during peak hour and I noticed the glass doors leading to the balcony weren't sound proof. The rooms also had a make up room and the bathrooms were a good size with showers that had great water pressure. We purchased an open red bus tour as well which is valid for 2 days for $28 which left from union square (less than 100 metres away) which got us every where e.g. China town, fishermans wharf, alcatraz cruise, pink ladies, haight, acadamy of sciences,etc. Our flight didn't leave San Fran until 11pm, but the hotel happily held our luggage from check out in the morning until we left the city at 8pm. I think the room worked out to be $200 per night including tax. There was also free wi fi but I had trouble getting on sometimes. Air con was good and you could control the temp yourself. There was a pool but it was too cold to go in. All in all great stay and I would definitely stay again if back in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - it's (almost) perfect”
Reviews.Author: JanBerlin
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat, so can't staff attitude. We had a King Premier facing the inner pool courtyard. Definately ask for one of those as outside facing rooms must be terribly noisy and the lower room categories seem to be a mixed bag . That said, our Premier Room was just perfect: spacious, clean, comfortable, nicely furnished (great bed), free WiFi and morning newspaper. The only downpoints: front desk was very busy at check-in and had to answer several calls during the check-in process which made it pretty lengthy. Furthermore, my request for a non-connecting room (made when making reservations) could not be honoured (the hotel was fully booked) and given the famous paper thin U. S. doors, we were witnesses of some interesting things going on next door (luckily the people - they changed daily - were silent at night - don't they get that when they can hear US, we can hear THEM?) In general, the hotel is not for the extremely noise sensitive: even in our room facing the inner courtyard, there was a constant vent noise and you cound hear the toilet flushing from other rooms. But that said, if your a good sleeper, go there. It's one of the best bets around.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff, Loveliest Rooms - A top experience”
Reviews.Author: hangingoutwithkids
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. We stayed in the newer section of the hotel at the back of the hotel. It was a little noisy - but what a great location - and we came to San Francisco for the hustle and bustle. The staff were outstanding. My young son left a soft toy in his bed on our last night and the housekeeping staff found it and posted it on to us in Florida. We were so impressed. The rooms were outstanding clean and big for this wonderfully central location. We were very happy here. And will certainly return. The location is excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for San Francisco Trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: lrmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Handlery in October, would def recommend to people visiting the city. Overall best thing about the hotel is the location, right off Union Square, next to good bars/restaurants/coffee shops and all the major department stores. We had a lovely room at the back of the hotel, very modern, big flat screen TV, coffee maker, lovely bed. Check in and out very quick and easy. I would suggest requesting a room at the back as I think it could be quite noisy on street facing side.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service and in need of a good renovation. Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: jmissy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights for our honeymoon and seriously wished we'd gone else where. The front of desk service was terrible with lack of manners and not a care in the world that we were paying customers. There was a dirt towel in our room, air con that didn't work and the room was located next to the ice machine and lift so we asked to be moved. Due to it being 'busy' we only had the choice of upgrading at our cost. We are glad we did the room was alot bigger but needed updated and no curtains just flimsy wooden blinds. I really would recommend going else where if not I've warned you.

Reviews.Title: “More dated than the pictures imply”
Reviews.Author: helryder
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a twin room, small room but very clean and tidy. The bed was pretty soft so if you are someone who likes a firm bed then you might want to look elsewhere. The decor in the room in modern but the rest of the hotel is very dated. Concierge was a little grumpy and not that helpful when we asked what I would think are standard tourist questions. I was choosing between this one and the Grand Hyatt when I planned our trip and having seen it I think the Grand Hyatt would be better value for money. The location is very good for shopping and an easy walk to the cable car, there are plenty of homeless people around this location but they are all pretty harmless.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value!”
Reviews.Author: umtmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery Inn for 3 nights at the end of August 2010. We had a standard double room, with 2 double beds and it was quite a spacious room with coffee making facilites and hair dryer. The bathroom was clean and the shower was great. We did not have a view, but did not mind as we were sight seeing all day. We did not have the noise from the street either, so it was very quite at night time. Although we were supposed to be room only, we got complimentary breakfast for the 3 days. This was a choice of hot American breakfast with toast, Waffle or granola and fruit and a selction of tea or coffee. This was a pleasant surprise and very generally service at breakfast was excellent, although was often very busy. The hotel was centrally located and just a few minutes walk from the centre of Union Square, the Powell & Mason Cable Car and numerous shops and large department stores. We would recommend staying here rather than Fishermans Warf and Pier 33, as you can travel don to these areas during the day. For us there were several highlights of San Fransisco. Alcatraz was excellent (book online in advance through Alcatraz Cruises, approx $26 each for early bird tour - alot less people at this time). It was great to see the Golden Gate Bridge (although very foggy the first day we were there), eat in the Cliff House Restaurant, visit Golden Gate Park,take in a ball game only a few stops away),Pier 33 and all the usual tourist spots. If travelling on the Cable Car (return journey is approx $10 each) you still need to queue after you have bought the tickets. Even though the homeless guy in the orange vest is shouting that you don't need to! Do be careful as lots of homeless people about and do not walk to the left (away from Union Square) when you me out of the hotel. Generally though, San Fransisco seems fairly safe, just be careful of wallets etc as in any large city. We only wish we had longer in SF as 3 nights was not enough to see all the attractions. Next time we would like to do the Alcatraz night time tour and the movie tour. Be sure to bring a few layers as the weather is very changable, but it is such a great city to see!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Truls58
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good service and in the middle of what ever you want from SF.

Reviews.Title: “The service was spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: paoco
Reviews.Content: The front desk was as friendly as if they'd known us for years. I was traveling with friends I'd known since I was 2 and we were celebrating our birthdays. The hotel gave us a wonderful surprise for this celebration. The bell boy took care of us as if we were his sisters new to a big city. The room was lovely, clean, and comfortable.
